Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: OhioGhh
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights in this hotel with my 2 daughters (both in their 20s). We had a tripple with a loft bed which was perfect for us. The location could not have been better...we walked to Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Plaza, and more. Time Square is a half block away as is the subway. The staff is wonderful and the decor fun and funky...very New York! My only suggestions for improvement would be better lighting in the bathroom and perhaps another person at the front desk. A large party arrived just before us and had a lot of questions about where to go, etc which made our wait to check in very long. Both just minor things....I will definately make this my spot to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy1110
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via last minute.com and got a great price for it. Stayed here for 3 nights in December and could not fault it. O.k, its not a 5* rated hotel but you get what you pay for and this exceeded our expectations. It was clean, the staff were friendly and the room was a decent size (for New York!) with a large bathroom. Located approx. 2minutes walk from times square, lots of deli's, cafe's and bars surrounding it. Loved the look of the cosy indoor pool, but never got a chance to use it! If you are looking for a luxurious stay in New York, look elsewhere! But, if you want a functional, modern, well located room with a comfy bed to rest your bones on after a days sightseeing, then Room Mate Grace is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “good location and modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnickCat
Reviews.Content: I love Room Mate Hotels! They are modern, with young spirit and with great breakfast! Room was a bit small, but I guess it's normal in a big city as NY. I stayed only one night so didn't had the chance to use the swimming pool. It's located near Times Square, so great location!

Reviews.Title: “Young, Modern, Overpriced Maybe?”
Reviews.Author: adambb86
Reviews.Content: Was attracted by the hotel the moment i stepped into the reception as i noticed the pool bar and tranquil Simply Red music as the back drop to a party going on in the foreground - I had to stay here the next time i was in NYC. Our stay was what i expected apart from the party stated above. Hotel was modern and hip in a location second to none. Only looming criticism was the actual price.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel not so much the service”
Reviews.Author: Mia D
Reviews.Content: great place not such a great service...did not like the lady at the front desk very inappropiate and rude only seemed to care about offering tours to us while customer service was at the lowest level. On another note, construction work from the building adjacent to the hotel makes it a bit hard for a good sleep, so that is definetely another negative. However, once you rolled up in those beds, you sleep like in heaven; they are absolutely comfy. Cleanliness deserves an excellence award, everything is impeccable, everything seems to shine. Great brekfast and decor. Overall loved the hotel, but not so much the service. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Euro Chic in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: L_Mystique
Reviews.Content: We came here for a business trip. 16 of us- some of us shared rooms with bunk beds and some shared the queen room. Pros: Location Location Location! Plus free breakfast. When you are on the run from 9-5 with meetings all over town: getting a free breakfast at the hotel definitely help. Interior is also pretty. They have a swim up bar and a small lounge. It gets ridiculously busy on weekends. (Pool parties) Cons: The size. It is small. Think European Chic. Everything is narrow-they only have 2 elevators and sometimes getting in/out can be a hassle due to that. Other than that, it's a great hotel. Much nicer looking than other hotels in the area. It's not crazy expensive but it's moderate. Definitely will stay in the bunk beds again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Drewhd
Reviews.Content: In NYC for my birthday. 4 nights. 2 nights in a budget hotel and 2 nights planned at the Grace. That was until we turned up to find out that there had been a 'glitch' in the system and we were being moved to another hotel. This news was delivered in a 'so what' manner with the receptionest telling us as if it was normal. I couldn't believe this especially when we had recieved confirmation and they had taken the money off my card a month prior to our arrival. The hotel that they tried to push us off to was a definite step down from the grace but the 'good news' was that it was the same price. No spa or pool or similar facilities but still considered acceptable for them to do without informing us until we got there. We decided to cancel our booking and find a new hotel. Bookings.com were great at helping with this. As was the guy that we dealt with when we went back later to get our luggage. The girl that served us when we first got there was rude. In the end, I can't believe that they found it acceptable to move us to a lesser quality hotel and not inform us until we got there. I won't be booking again...

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffhsap
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool and dare I say sexy hotel. The pool, steam and sauna areas are really pretty awesome for any hotel. This area on the weekends turns into a night club that is rocking, there is a bar in the pool area. Someone mentioned that it was loud, and yes it was when you walked in however it did not have any impact on our stay, we couldn't hear a thing in the room we stayed. The rooms are small yes, but they are nice and we were not there to hang out in the room. The best part of our room was the shower which was very big and hot. Our room was clean and the bed was very nice. Just my wife and I were up in NYC for the weekend so we didn't need a lot of space. Our rate was okay but 2 days before leaving the rate dropped on another site hotels.com would not match the price due to a policy with Room Mate Grace they claimed. We arrived a little before check in time but the folks at the front desk were able to get us a room that had just been serviced. This was a nice little perk considering we were a little tired and just wanted to rest for a few then get on to enjoying NYC. I would love to stay here again, I just hope to get the room for a price around $200, this time I paid $234 - $260. We found those working the front always very nice and like I said they went out of their way to get us a room early. If you are looking to stay near Times Square this is a nice one at a good price. Lots of places to eat in the area too. We really didn't do much in the area we just really wanted to stay in a central location near the subway that we could drop stuff off easily. For a young couple this place would be a great choice, for a family I'm not sure just because I didn't see those rooms but the indoor pool is a nice perk after a long day for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “We threw a private NYE party at the Grace”
Reviews.Author: michellejonas
Reviews.Content: I originally found the Grace when it was still called the QT. We were staying at the Muse nearby walking around the area we were wet and cold, it was winter and we saw a few people slip in to the bar there. When we followed suit we were surprised and amazed by the warm humidity and the swim up bar, pool, and lounge that greeted us. We immediately bought swim suits at the concession stand/front desk and enjoyed the saunas pool and bar all night. 5 years later we chose this spot to host a NYE party to ring in 2012. Aside from a few communication problems with the staff leading up to the event everything went off very smoothly. Our room was clean, comfortable and great. This is a small hotel and it has no restaurant, the staff works hard but is sometimes stretched thin. Its a happy party atmosphere, I would recommend for singles and young couples. You might catch a drag show in the lounge at night. Very nice experience overall. Very good Times square location. We saw the Book of Mormon, absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: geguileor
Reviews.Content: Great Great Great Location!! Perfect sized room for 2. Unlike other reviewers I did not experience loud music coming from below. The beds were very comfortable, each room is Equipt with their own thermostat which is amazing! The staff was very friendly. Definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but bathroom left something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Elise C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Room Mate Grace Hotel in NYC over MLK weekend. We have stayed there before and found the rooms to be extremely small, but fine to stay for one night due to the fantastic location and relatively cheap price. However, this time we found the set up quite strange. The shower and the toilet were in the same open space which causes the toilet to be unusable during a shower and you have to completely wipe down the toilet after a shower. Also, the shower area looked very unkempt thus we chose to drive home unshowered the next day, rather than risk it without any shower shoes. Unfortunately, this has tainted our view of the Room Mate and we will find another hotel next time we are in the NYC area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Ammenities!!!”
Reviews.Author: Life_O_Reilly
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us (sisters) going away to celebrate a birthday. Spacious rooms, delicious breakfast, fun night life the location AWESOME! Price for absolutely affordable! We got the quad room. Each bed had it's own TV, a refridgerator was in our room- just a great all around hotel with nice people that worked there and an awesome deal. If you're going to a show this is the place to stay right off broadway. Go to restaurant dot com to get a deal on dinner, lunch, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Cool & hip, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigergrl
Reviews.Content: I (age 33) and my sister (age 19) stayed at the Room Mate Grace in June of 2011. This was the perfect hotel for two gals on the go in NYC. I thought it was a great compromise on location, near Times Square, which my sis loved, but also not far from 5th Ave shopping and other sites. Loved the modern, sleek decor and our clean bunk bed room. Fridge in the room was great to keep drinks & snacks. We were given the wrong room type at first, but it was no problem switching to the right one. Beware there is not much privacy in the bathroom shower situation, but this did not bother us. Also note that the bar/swim area turns into a nightclub but being up on a higher floor the thumping music and crowds did not bother us. We ate the continental breakfast one day, but better meals are to be had out and about in the city. Overall, a wonderful stay, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and unique, good quality-price Supercentral”
Reviews.Author: valeriafranchi
Reviews.Content: You won't believe you are in TIMES SQUARE, and you can have such a nice room, in such a unique style for such a good price. Stylish and fun it is also very young atmosphere and so well projected for the choice of mixing the very cool lounge bar and the pool and the spa, you can have a drink in the little pool and relax in the sauna while watching people coming in from the reception, and bar spa and pool are the same enviroment and you can enjoy this spa atmosphere even if you don't feel like undressing...Our room was small but so much fun: four bunk beds one on top of the other, a huge shower and psychedelic wall papers made us feel a little bit like in the Andy Warrol Factory...The Staff was very professional and nice, we had a little problem in the room and they found the right and faster solution for us, we will for sure come back.

Reviews.Title: “"rite after the new year"”
Reviews.Author: scot b
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to time square. If there is an negative to the location it would be that there's not a subway station close to the hotel. pool area was fun and exciting. If you stay over the weekend, check out the bar/night club, the music is good and the crowd is very nice. I recommend a table by the pool on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: E K
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at The Room Mate Grace Hotel with my boyfriend. What an awesome place. It was recommended by a friend that has been there many times. Our complete stay was exactly what I was looking for. As soon as we arrived, we were politely greeted and checked-in with ease. I heard so much about the pool so we went for a nice swim and cocktail a few hours later. So relaxing which ended up to be more fun! Great music, good times! Our room was chic and cozy. Bed was soooooo comfortable! Slept like a QUEEN! Shower has an amazing set-up. Overall service at Room Mate Grace was very accomodating. It was a nice weekend. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Husbands 40th Birthday spent in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: dawn53381
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get this room at a great discount. Unlike other reviews I felt our room was spacious enough and was very clean. I am not one to sleep on a firm bed so that was a little uncomfortable but thats the chance you take when away from home.The staff was wonderful and we really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: Perry G
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend of Jan 6-8, 2012. The Grace had my booking wrong, took care of it, but then got it wrong again. The staff seemed harried and overwhelmed by the mid-afternoon traffic. Beware, the rooms are really small and VERY NOISY. The bed was on a raised platform that required the sleeper to 'jump' out of bed to the floor. I heard my neighbors above and next door jumping all night and morning. No amenities to speak of, aside from orange smelling shampoo and lotion. I could only watch the TV lying in bed. The positive: it's close to Time Square, and the price was reasonable compared to a big-name venue. Nonetheless, I'll not choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Want to have fun in New-York City ?”
Reviews.Author: JeromeNancy
Reviews.Content: When I read the other reviews then I'm asking myself.... Was it the same hotel I was staying at ? I visit NYC each year at the same period and this is my third time at this hotel and I still love it ! Excellent location (not far from E train - connection with JFK Airport). Very clean. Small but very comfortable rooms. Swimming pool, steam room, sauna.... the ideal place in winter to relax after a long shopping day !! Ask for a room on the upper floors. Regular parties in the pool area. A bit noisy when facing the street (construction site next to the building at the moment but usually quiet considering the location). Probably better for young couples used to travelling. Not suitable for families or for people who want something more classic.

Reviews.Title: “fantanstic!”
Reviews.Author: amandafouche
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 7th december 2011 for 4 nights, and the hotel was brillliant the rooms were small but we only slept in there, i mean u dont go to New York to stay in the hotel do you? . Hotel was clean fresh towels everyday, the staff was friendly and very helpfull had a great time we used the hotel night club on the wed and it was a great atomsphere, Just round the corner from Times Square very central from everywhere just want to be back there now where the city never sleeps... I love New York and would defo stay in the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely unable to sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: gailch37
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to NYC for one night on 12/17 to see the city decorated for the holidays. Although the hotel is a cool little place and the front desk staff were very nice, the noise is UNBEARABLE, COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE, like a dance club is in your room literally, like you'd have to be smoking crack or passed out to be able to sleep in the room.... I stayed in a quad on the third floor room with my mother and 11 year old daughter. We did not FALL asleep until after 5 am. Despite complaining to the front desk at around 2am, there was no change in the noise level. This lack of sleep completely ruined our trip in NY, especially for my daughter who was exhausted the next day. I complained to the manager who reimbursed me the entire $400 for the room which is great but doesnt make up for the fact that our entire day in NY on Sunday was ruined. And I guess the bottom line is that the managment of this hotel knows how ridiculous the noise level is but choose to keep the club opened despite the impact on the hotel guests. My brother and his wife stayed on the 10th floor and were not affected at all by noise. Not sure on what level you would be able to fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite price for value”
Reviews.Author: aishaa_03
Reviews.Content: Readers might be prompted to ask, "which hotel in nyc is quite price for value?" as you always pay a price above the standard coupled with all sorts of add-on taxes... Nonetheless, I really did not feel comfortable in this hotel, despite the fact there was nothing that was done "wrong" in particular. We stayed at Room Mate Grace during our anniversary. We chose this hotel in particular due to several reasons: 1. it was our anniversary and the hotel looked really chic and trendy on the concierge's web site (one we often used to use, but no longer will, therefore no point in sharing the name); 2. Location; 3. Good reviews else where; 4. Gym We were upgraded by the hotel staff when we told them that it was our anniversaries. What did go wrong then? The following: 1. The room that we were upgraded into was still very small. So, I do not want to think about the look of the standard room. 2. No duvet cover! In fact, there is only a white sheet that has been folded over the duvet itself. I tried not to ruin our holiday by complaining over or thinking too much about it; but God knows who else used that duvet before... 3. There is a club downstairs next to the lobby... And, on one Saturday night, I'm afraid the bodyguards almost asked for our IDs as we tried to make it to the elevators to go to sleep. 4. Gym: Two broken bicycles in a sqm box. Some dumbless and a flabby swiss ball. Nothing else. Not even a treadmill. 5. Pool: is used for DJ parties, so I wouldn't want to swim in that same pool later on. I guess the problem might be with me as well, but I do not like the so-called "trendy" hotels. All they do is color the elevators, use funky wall-papers and carpeting to look trendy. to me with a disco downstairs, the hotel no longer feels that safe and I really do not enjoy the fact that cleanliness is forsaken for the sake of trendiness...

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs if you actually want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieEF60713
Reviews.Content: Horrible place to stay unless you're more interested in a party than a quiet room! The loud music from the bar reverberates throughout the hotel and blasts music until the wee hours. It'd be cheaper to party in the bar and then sleep at a nearby hotel that's quieter. Waste of money!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: D Kellie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our daughters (6 and 8 years old) and enjoyed the ideal location walking distance from Rockefeller Center; Radio City Music Hall; Central Park; Times Square; etc. The indoor pool with swim up pool, sauna and steam room were just wonderful and it was great that they were open 24 hours. The hotel was clean, modern and the rooms (although small) were extremely comfortable and very clean. The staff was excellent and the service terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything - the hotel is nice too!”
Reviews.Author: soul2go
Reviews.Content: Great spot near Times Square. Family friendly (with a bunk in the room that really went over well). Clean and stylish enough. TV could use updating. 10th floor was still loud - but it is a block from Times Square. DVD player and small fridge in room. Would (will?) stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: andlintown
Reviews.Content: I really, really wanted to like RMG. I tried hard. Unfortunately, the only thing this place had going for it is location - 1/2 block from Time Square. Customer Service: very disorganized. Appalling. The left hand doesnt seem to know what the right hand is up to. We had 4 adults and 4 children with us. We reserved 2 quad bunk rooms about 4 months in advance. We stored our luggage at about 10:30 and were assured our rooms would be ready promptly at 3 PM. After touring the city we had some very tired, small children. And adults! We arrived at the hotel at 3:30 finding that only one room was ready. The other would be ready in "20 minutes". Well repeat this scenario for another 2 hours. We repeatedly called checking on the status of the other room. Each time we talked to someone different and were given a different story. It was ready and the key was being sent up. 30 minutes later oh it's not ready it's still being cleaned. 20 minutes later it's being checked by housekeeping and we're bringing the key to you now. At 5:30 I stormed downstairs ready to check out completely. The two at the front desk acted as though this was all brand new information, they argued about what room we were to have, and then assured us the key was being sent up. I demanded a key in my hand before I left that desk or I was checking out completely. Needless to say I received the key and we went up to our room, after demanding a lower rate as well. Also, everyone had very thick accents. Which is fine, I have no issue with that...but not one single American is employed by this hotel in any regard...? Seems a bit strange an makes me wonder about their business practices. Rooms: clean but in need of repair. The wallpaper is gashed and peeling. The carpet is worn. The TVs are mismatched and broken. Lights broken. Requested that a broken light and tv be repaired - neither were. Asked again and were told it takes several days to put in a "work order"...? Stayed 2 days and never addressed further. The shower is all tile and while clean, the grout is stained. Also, beware that only a thin shower curtain Seperates the shower from the rest of the room. Kinda weird. The beds are comfy. But know this room is functional and that's all. Noise: be aware this hotel has a club scene and plays bass laden music until about 3 am 5 days a week. Problematic for lower floors. Overall: if you plan on just sleeping in your hotel while NYC the RMG will probably suffice. It's not a luxury hotel. It's not even a fun boutique. Another reviewer said its more like a hostel and I agree. But the location is excellent and for the price you probably won't find better in that regard. I think the RMG may have been neat and fun at one time but it is in swrious need of an overhaul in both appearance and customer service. So if you can live with a lipsticked pig, the RMG is probably for you. We, however, won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: jhoyle51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grace Hotel. We had an amazing time. We read some of the earlier reviews and stayed on an upper floor, our room was on the 11th floor. We didn't have any problems at all with the hotel, room or the service. The location is very close to time square. If there is an negative to the location it would be that there's not a subway station close to the hotel but that's not an reason that will change our mind on staying here next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: djImhotep
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right in Times Square, very safe 24/7. From check in to check out everything was a perfect. The staff is great, very friendly, genuine and always willing to help. Raphael, the night auditor, went above and beyond the call of duty to make my stay very enjoyable. If you stay over the weekend, check out the bar/night club, the music is good and the crowd is very nice. I recommend a table by the pool on the second floor. Again, the service is outstanding, you do really feel like your room mate was taking care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in quiet room”
Reviews.Author: bergo
Reviews.Content: The reception is a welcoming point for the guests and is at this hotel a small and cramped space where you have to find your way to the elevators. Rooms are nice, practical and complete. Size is small but that's normal in nyc. Breakfast is excellent as tge price is good and you have everything you need. Coffee machine could be replaced as taste is horrible. Pool, steamroom and sauna all look very nice but i didnt use them unfortunately. Overall a great stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I <3 Room Mate Grace”
Reviews.Author: Tennisbabes
Reviews.Content: Yes-the rooms are small. Yes -it could benefit from a little TLC but I stayed with my 16 year old daughter and we both absolutely loved it. It has a great"vibe" about it and the bar/pool area is super cool. The location is perfect and the staff were helpful and friendly. TIP- ask for a room away from the construction work if you are a light sleeper=although the bed is so comfortable I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “You DON'T get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: I realized this place had shortfalls when I booked. Their reservation engine does not warn you that your reservation is non refundable until after you have made the reservation. I was stuck with a "Deluxe" room, which was prepaid. After reading Trip Advisor I would have moved elsewhere but they had already charged me. The "Deluxe" rooms appear to be at the high end of what this upscale hostel has to offer. Unfortunately, they did not honor my reservation and put me in a four bunk bed loft fit for an army recruit. The night "auditor" offered to "cancel" my pre paid reservation to compensate me for my misforetune. They also gave me a very low floor, next to a construction site. He told me there was nothing he can do and that I should ask for another room the next day. But wait, I paid for a higher category and got "bunked". I should get a refund AND an upgrade above the so called "Deluxe" room. With this guy's attitude, I will probably not even get my Deluxe room. The place is loud and the lobby is tiny. In the words of the night "auditor": "all rooms are quirky..." I wonder what awaits me. I cannot say I was not forewarned. Unfortunately, I was stuck as my reservation was prepaid (without a warning). In a word: DISGUSTED!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: africaboundTexas
Reviews.Content: The showers are full of mildew. Service is bad. The rooms are unbelievably small. The walls are paper thin. The decor is awful and nauseating. Way, way, way over priced!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! Please read and save yourselves...”
Reviews.Author: mike s
Reviews.Content: Where to start, room we paid for was not given to us when we arrived. We booked the deluxe king suite and go a double bed in an awful room, with rotting baseboards, mouldy tiles, carpet from your high school library and a covered sliding door into a window that leaked cold air like a screen door. Not to mention the smell of asian cuisine which I usually don't mind, however it compulsively filled the room day and night. Finally after we complained 4 times and 24 hrs later they moved us to a king bed which had other people's hair in it, stains on the linen's and other evidence that the pillow, sheets and comforter hadn't been cleaned in what could be a week. It was disgusting. Something else that was disgusting, the service...not once did they reach out to correct or offer incentive for the awful experience, spanish was spoken between co-workers in front of us while we were trying to resolve issues at the front desk, the entire operation is out dated and really just sad to see that a hotel like this can even still exist. Worst hotel experience in 15 years of travel and 50+ hotels. Never stay here. Simple.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU WANT TO SLEEP, DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Nikki N
Reviews.Content: This was the noisiest hotel I have ever been in. I will NEVER stay in this hotel ever again. Let's see, where do I begin. The doors slam shut. If you open your door and the neighbor opens theirs, you might as well be in the same room. The size of the rooms are extrememly small. We had a "triple, not comfortable for 3 people. The television is mounted in one fixed position to the wall, so unless you are directly in front of it (laying on the bed), you can't see it. NO PRIVACY in the shower area. You open the shower curtain and you are now in view of the entire room. We were on the 4th floor and the music from the bar on the 2nd floor kept us up all night and morning. We had to go to the lobby at 430 am to ask to shut it off. Apparently the Maintenance man is the only one who can shut it off, and he's hard to find. It finally went off close to 5am. Only to be rudely awakened again about an hour and half later by the people in the room next door who were in and out of their room about 35 times in an hour and who stood in the doorway talking to one another. Then the cleaning crew started. That was Thanksgiving day. The following night we escaped the music, but were awakened at about 6am to the jackhammer being used on the building under construction next door which was directly outside our window. The staff at the front desk offered us free breakfast for our inconvience. Who the hell wanted to eat breakfast after the horrible nights we had. We were supposed to stay 3 nights and checked out after 2 (we ended our trip early because we were all exhausted from not sleeping).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: Beds extremely comfortable and excellent location. Rooms a little small for our tastes. Friendly staff. Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best day's are over..”
Reviews.Author: zuune
Reviews.Content: This hotel previous had the name QT, by changing ownership the hotel also lost atmosphere. Also the new building that is under construction on the other side of the wall make the neighborhoods to a constructor place The noise from the constructionplace are terrible. The breakfast is still god and the included in the price, but it does not help.

Reviews.Title: “Traveled all day to find out that they were overbooked and were sent to another hotel that was not as nice.”
Reviews.Author: Eric G
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to NYC for a weekend getaway and planned to stay at Grace. We showed up at the hotel and began the check in process. The front desk clerk (Rolando) swiped my card and printed out a document for us to sign for the room. This all seemed very typical. After I signed off on the room, he then preceded to tell us that we have been moved to a hotel about 2 blocks away. Furthermore, the hotel we were moved to was not as nice and did not have any of the same amenities. It was just a tiny little room 2 blocks south. The whole process was handled poorly and was very shady. The worst part is, after calling to complain they said that they knew that the hotel was booked for 2 weeks prior to our trip but failed to notify us of the overbooking and we were just broad sided when we showed up. Not to mention we were standing at the front desk for 10 minutes thinking we were getting checked in before they told us we were getting the boot... Bottom line, if we had not shown up without canceling or giving prior notice, the hotel would have charged us the full amount like we had stayed there. All they could say was they are sorry and we will call you back. What a scam... F@#king thieves if you ask me. Don't stay there. Find a place where they at least have integrity....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, clean, comfy and chic rooms”
Reviews.Author: SmurfetteSue
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the theaters, I felt safe in the area. Room is a tad small (have many bruises on my legs from knocking into corners, or maybe I'm just clumsy!) but clean, chic, comfy bed. You have everything you need in the room - hairdryer, safe deposit box, toiletries, towels, etc. No complaints whatsoever. Loved the bar on the second floor too, DJ played great music. I was not disturbed by the noise from the bar, perhaps it was because I asked for a high floor. I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness, comfort, chic design, and reasonable price for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedigreebull
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally a few steps away from the bright lights of Times Square, a huge plus if it is your first few visits to NYC. Very convenient to all the shops, walking distance to Rockefeller Center, nice dining spots that suit different budgets. On the hotel itself, there is not much space in lobby area I think it is because a large focus is on revenue from drinks. From the check-in counter (where they sell drinks behind the cashier) to the area next to the lifts (where you enter into the bar area at night) before you go up to your room, we felt like we were in a scaled down version of a bar, although a chic one because you can see an indoor pool by bar area from where you are waiting for the lift. The room itself (wife and I had a deluxe room) was pretty decent and comfortable. Mattress a little soft and bouncy but ok. Right next door, they are building something from the ground up so in the mornings until evenings, there is quite a bit of noise especially of construction people shouting to each other. No noise from heavy type equipment but enough to wake you from 7 am. From look of things, construction is likely to go on for at least another 6 to 9 months. I think on lower floors, you can hear clubbing type music (quite faint though) whilst you are lying in bed, until like 3 am. You can only watch TV from the bed (not seating area). Free wireless was a bonus. We got the room for 4 nights from a room broker after researching for several weeks. Had a good deal on the deluxe room. All in, traditional hotel lobbies don't interest you, sleeping for 5 to 6 hours is enough for you, you are not one to sleep in the mornings, looking for a comfortable and clean hotel (not dark or dated), I think this hotel will work for you. Personally, I will stay there again if there is a good room rate. I am undecided whether to rate this hotel as 3 or 4 but decided on a 3 because we stayed there for 4 nights. If your stay is shorter, the hotel can actually provide a little lift in spirits given its proximity to Times Square, the shops in the area, and its own clubbing scene at night.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business, oops”
Reviews.Author: LineNoise
Reviews.Content: After a 6AM flight and southwest neglecting to get my equipment on the plane we arrived to the hotel to drop our bags, but were interrupted by the staff complaining about a guest being upset about them taking their personal pillow out of the room! This was awkward to say the least. The room was actually pretty nice. The shower was huge! So the second night of our stay the place turned into a nightclub, it was a "Model networking event" from what I could gather. There were 4 girls and like 8,000 guys. The place was loud, packed and two guys smoking up in the sauna/pool area. I retreated to my room where I was high enough up where I thankfully couldn't hear it. 6AM starts the construction site up next door. No sleeping in for me. The whole time I am taking a shower a crane hook is going past my window. Don't take the car service they have sitting out there, unless you of course like to think you're going to die.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Jo1988
Reviews.Content: You couldn't get any closer to Times Square if you tried - this chic hotel is just around the corner from Swatch and Planet Hollywood. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the place always had a buzz about it. The only real downside is the size. Everything is a little small, but for the price and location I would DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Near to the Action”
Reviews.Author: steve16
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via some web search's and managed to get a really good rate. The rooms are not the largest but they have all you need in order to rest your head and chill out. The greatest aspect was its distance from Time Square, just a short walk (2 mins) and your in the heart of the action and also 15 minutes walk from the Empire State. Loads of shops and places to eat ...... and some nice bars on the hotels door step. We tried to book an extra night but unfortunately the rate would not have been the same......shame.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: stehanie b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the roomate grace sept 30- oct 4th on the 9th floor in an amazing room, i loved how each floor had a different theme, very cool, they had a nightclub which looked lilke a lot of fun, i was so busy running around that i didnt really have time to check out the pool either, but there was a pool party one of the nights i was there and it looked amazing, i didnt try the breakfast so i wouldnt know if its good, i did use the computer they had and of course like most places they do charge a fee to use the internet but that was fine. Housekeeping was amazing cleaned our room daily and provided fresh towels, the location was great literaly a 2 min walk to times sqaure , saw two broadway plays we walked both times and it was so close one was at winter garden theatre and one was at the gershwin theatre both very close to hotelm amazing restaraunts went toa fridays which was within walking distance subways everywhere and easy to get taxis unless it was night time or raining then it was a little hard, overall had an amazing stay, highly reccomen this hotel, espeically if you want to be by times square, and we had a nice excursion car pick us up to the airport, which the hotel kindly arranged for a price of 50 dollars inculding the tip.. cant beat that

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Remmingtun
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was traveling with a friend who has 3 kids. They have rooms with 4 bunk beds (each bed has it's own T.V.) so I thought it would be perfect for them. I booked 2 of those rooms. They got to the hotel early (8am) and were thankfully allowed to check in. Very nice. We got there around 2pm and were told our rm wasn't ready yet. Okay, fine. Around 4-5pm we were told there were no rooms avaliable of that type,so they were going to give us two rms (same price). We agreed. As it turns out, we were very lucky there weren't any of those rms left because my friends room was on the floor right above the pool and the music was so loud, they couldn't sleep until it stopped. Somewhere around 2am!!!! I wouldn't book this hotel again unless guaranteed to be on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Small but it worked”
Reviews.Author: wanderwoman33
Reviews.Content: Very very small room, you better like who you're bunking with! And the hallways are really freaky painted. But is was in the best location in Times Square. Minutes walk to the subways, Broadway, and times square of course. As we got more familiar with our surroundings in the city it became apparent that it was a central location to everything we saw on the trip. Breakfast was more than adequate and helped start our days so we didn't have to hunt down food every morning. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wallpaper Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: shaunaheinicke
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is pretty friggin' sweet - friendly staff, great retro-modern decor, upgraded fixtures and finishes, super-steamy shower, Time Out NY magazine, and a customizable mini-bar. We stayed in a standard room and it was definitely on the small side. I didn't mind it, though, only having access to one side of the bed is a little annoying when someone has to get up and crawl over the other person in the middle of the night. The bed was very comfortable and upon initial inspection [for bed bugs or whatever else may be lurking - nothing!] the mattress appeared to be falling apart and had staples hanging out of the sides so, it's a good thing we sleep on the top side of the mattress. Good location, only a block or so from Times Square, and pubs aplenty.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: CraigLMcCloud
Reviews.Content: A week before my check-in date, I called to confirm my reservation. They had no record of it. The reservation was made 9 months prior. After several phone calls, numerous emails and three days, my reservation was confirmed. The Grace's manager (?), Daniela, was very helpful and did an excellent job of getting everything "squared-away". I called a few days early and requested an early check-in and my room was ready as requested at 10 am. The check-in was smooth and easy. The room was "porn-like"....in my opinion very modern and chic...perfect for a single urban-traveler. However, it was VERY small and contained VERY little storage. I couldn't imagine having my spouse or a fellow traveler to share the room with. The beds were like a fluffy cloud...very comfy...and I mean one of the best hotel beds I have EVER slept in. The was a problem with the cable. It seemed (told to me via an employee) that the hotel had forgotten to pay the cable bill and numerous channels in the hotel tv lineup were disconnected. This was never resolved during my stay. The breakfast each morning was very good. A bit pricey at $13 per morning...but a great selection of food and served until 10. The pool, sauna & steam room were wonderful. The pool was a bit cool...but very nice. The only BIG problem that I had was the in-room internet. I was in NYC on business and needed to access my offices via internet remote access. After four - five calls to the internet service tech....the internet issues were left unresolved. The techs' responses were..."it seems to be a signal issue and we can't fix that". The problem with this was ....when the signal was actually being broadcast....it was registering on my laptop at 4/5 bars....so there was adequate signal. I angerily left an entire week's worth of emails and problems to my assistant to tackle without much oversight. Location was wonderful. 5 Irish Pubs within a 30-second walk, Great vendor food carts, 1 block from Times Square, 1 block from 6th Ave, and very short walk to Rock. Center. Would I stay here again? Depends on if they get the internet issue resolved. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & facilities”
Reviews.Author: gaynorchin
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you are catching Broadway shows as it's on the same street or a couple of blocks away from the theatres. It is just off Times Square about 2 mins walk away from the action. Check-in was prompt. The room we had was a king size with a single bunk. Very comfortable beds, but when we got to our room the duvet on the king size bed was wet on one side, weird! The room has it's own air-conditioner, free wi-fi, ipod docking system, tv, fridge and hotel amenities except for shower cap which was weird as well. The front desk offers complimentary apples! We were on the 3rd floor and could hear the night club below everynight, but we were so tired we didn't notice it when asleep. The staff were very helpful and we would definately stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Looking Hotel But With RUBBISH SERVICE! STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret83London
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to pick Room Mate Grace for our whistle-stop trip, given the perfectly central location of the hotel. Quite unfortunately, the hotel's aesthetics were simply a facade given the horrendously poor customer service we received from a particular receptionist and the malfunctioning state of their facilities in general. All through our trip, the steam room was out of service and had been even days Before we actually arrived but the 'lovely' receptionists could not be bothered to give the hotel guests any notice of this! Furthermore, the 'double bed' that was offered in our room was as tiny as they come! Pretty shocking, considering how expensive the room was. Also, the hotel alarms went ballistic around 6am for a full hour one morning for no reason! The staff, yet again, were totally useless in providing any information as to why that happened or to even apologise for the hideous and unecessary noise. Basically, if you want good customer service, well sized rooms for a bargain And a fully-functioning spa, DO NOT STAY AT Room Mate Grace! If, on the other hand, you don't care about such matters, are on a very short trip And care more about being in the heart of Times Square, stay here...at your own peril! ;)

Reviews.Title: “After staying at the casablanca, nothing compares”
Reviews.Author: holacrayola01
Reviews.Content: We arrived and they sent us to another hotel for one night due to a reservation error from their part. So that was an inconvenience. When we finally got back to the hotel, I have to say they gave us a very pretty room on the top floor with a great view. So that together with the fact that the location of the hotel is amazing, our stay was great. However my boyfriend found a flee and for those who don't like loud music, make sure to ask for a room above the fifth floor to make sure you don't suffer with the bar music.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bed”
Reviews.Author: Bowangie
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Grace in NYC. The location was great. We were only a block or so from our theatre and a lot of other attractions in Times Square. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Some of the most accommodating desk people I have ever experienced. We loved our room and bath area. The space was small but efficiently designed. There was plenty of room to place our things in a closet. One note to the wise: I was reading reviews about the hotel while on my train, coming into NY. It mentioned that it is better to get a room on a higher floor because noise from the bar/pool area can be a problem late at night. Our original room was lower. We asked and we were put on the 14th floor. It was quiet. The review was true because when we came home from the theatre the bar area was hopping and one could hear the noise on the 2nd floor. I assume the 3rd floor might have had the same problem. By and large it is a younger crowd who stays at the hotel but there were other age groups. For NYC we found the prices reasonable and the room very comfy and fun. The location can't be beat. The front desk staff will also arrange a private car with tip included to the airport (in our case, LaGuardia) for $50.00. It was worth it. It is a little more than a taxi but a good deal. We will definitely stay here again and check out Room Mate hotels in some other cities. Oh! and the bed.....It was marvelous! We didn't want to get out of it. Terrifically comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Short time stay”
Reviews.Author: azngirl988
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The place is located to various eating areas, a pub right next door and a bar/lounge located on the 1st level of the hotel. So if you like to drink or need a nightlife, this is a nice location. Walking distance to Rockefeller center and times square. Stayed on the 15th floor, in a 1 bedroom suite. The bathroom and shower were clean. The bed was clean, the pillows and mattress were a little flat but good enough for 1 night. The room was small, it was good for 2 small people but it maybe uncomfortable if you like space. At night was pretty quiet on the 15th floor, avoid the 2 and 3rd floor is you dont like noise from the lounge. About 530am you can hear the traffic even on the 15th floor but its not bad. Overall good experience, cool hip place, if you are looking for quiet non-hip scene, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Angela h
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for 4 nights we found the location was perfect the staff were very helpful. The hotel room was spotless and the bed was the most comfortable that I have ever slept in (it was a bit high though). The only down side was that they didnt serve a hot breakfast there however, the cafe about 3 doors away was brilliant. Definite value for money would definitely stay there again if we went back to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and clean design; poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret Z
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the set-up of our rooms, but we were unhappy that we were charged for breakfast without being informed, and that our rooms were not regularly cleaned and restocked with towels. Also, the air conditioning was faulty. A great deal for the price, and I'd stay there again, but don't expect luxury treatment. I must say, however, that the beds and pillows are MAGNIFICENT!

Reviews.Title: “Cool modern hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Piero8181
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June while on Business in NYC with my boss, we are both relatively young and fancied somewhere different to the usual old fashioned NYC Hotels....well this hotel didn't let us down. Location is ideal, few steps away from Time Square and 5th Avenue so perfect for shoppers, inside the vibe is funky and contempory throughout, the last night there we came back after dinner to find a full blown pool party taking place, with DJ's and drinking in the pool, I did wish that I had brought my swimming shorts! One thing, if you do want a quiet room then request a high floor, I did this based on the reviews on TA and it was the best thing I did, total silence on the 9th floor! You don't want to be in the rooms above the pool party that is for sure! One negative and it's a big one if you are there on business, the Free Wi-Fi is rubbish and I didn't get a good enough signal so I had to pay for the Computer by the check-in desk. Book with confidence, I will be back in November for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & contemporary, great location, right price.”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: Overall - this place was pretty cool and I would go back. The hotel is unique, and is very contemporary - so you better know that up front. This isn't the Marriott Marquis. From the lobby pool and club to the guest rooms - this place has a cool vibe. Platform bed was different, but very comfy. The minimalist design made the space feel bigger - a plus given how small NY hotel rooms can be. Rainshower shower was awesome. Not a big fan of the square shampoo and bath gel bottles, but you can't have it all. Minibar idea was awesome! Stock up at the front desk (u haul or they will) at great prices and into your fridge in the room. And free wireless! Location was spectacular - right off Times Square. Only detractions are - if you want a larger size hotel room, this isn't your place - if you like to order room service, this isn't your place - if you like to watch TV from someplace other than bed, this isn't your place - if you don't like to climb anything to get into bed (there is a little platform you have to climb to get into bed), this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Hotel....Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (26 years old) stayed at The Room Mate Grace Hotel in NYC for 3 nights. I had read reviews on Travelocity and was very pleased because everyone had great stuff to say, I can now also included nothing but great comments! The locations is SOOO perfect you are 5 steps away from all the hustle and bustle of Time Square! There is a deli/conveniance store, a Starbucks, a Steak house,and a bar not even 2 steps away from the hotel. The staff was unbelievably friendly never in my life have I seen so many smiles and welcoming faces always ready and willing to help. The rooms are very reasonably sized for a NYC hotel, very modern rooms and modern amenities very Art Deco BOUTIQUE style hotel! I enjoyed the hotel because it was not overly crowded only about 10-12 rooms per floor, and the elevators are quick! The hotel has a hook up with an indoor parking garage a block away which costs 25$ a day instead of 45$...Great deal for Midtown lots!!! I read alot of reviews of people who said to make a request to have a room above the 4th floor due to the music from the pool/bar located on the main floor, I did take those precautions so we never heard loud music, however I dont know if the walls are thin but the room next to us had a child and we heard lots of noise (again not sure if its because their was a noisy child or if the walls were just thin) I will defintely stay here again and I will tell all my friends about it!

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TrWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: It is renewed again since my last visit which was a year ago.The location is great. Very close to theaters.The bed is amazing. Great breakfast ( although missing the rasberries, blueberries they had before ). Would recommend and stay anytime i visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased.”
Reviews.Author: LVictorA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spend a few days in NY at the end of each Summer. We decided to stay closer to Time Square this year as we were staying less time but attempting to see several shows. Although justa short walk to the theaters and shopping, the Hotel is on a fairly quiet street with someplace to grab a snack just two doors way open 24 hours (Cranberry). The room we chose (king with a bunk bed) gave us plenty of room and was very comfortable. Would have liked a curtain for the bathroom area to facilitate privacy when changing but otherwise it was great. The staff, especially the front desk, was very good. They were not only pleasant but seemed to have a predisposition to being helpful. I watched as they assisted some International travelers who arrived although their reservations must have been messed up because the staff had to make some special arrangements. It appeared as though the staff was not only able to assist the group, but took extraordinary measures to make the weary travelers feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: olive235
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel, conveniently located in Times Square NYC (2 minutes walk from the main drag!). The room I was allocated on the first night was on the third floor, which was directly above the nightclub that runs downstairs. This made the room very noisy, so if you are looking for a quite nights rest choose a room 4th floor or higher! The room was great though, with 4 single beds, perfect for a friends weekend away. I transferred to a higher floor for the second night, and was surprised by the size of the room, very spacious. The hotel has very funky decor, and the staff were friendly and helpful. I have no complaints about this hotel, it is very good value for money, just ensure you choose a higher floor for your hotel room!! Free internet is a bonus, and having a fridge in the room helps save money on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and hip”
Reviews.Author: elhamrem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated 50 m from Times Square and that is excellent. The staff is nice and friendly. Pool is small, but nice. The rooms are small, but clean, very hip and cool. Wonderful beds, but we had no view and a small, corner window. So I did not want to stay in the room other then for sleep. Outside was very hot and I missed a place to stay indoors sometimes to relax in cool temperatures. The lobby is dark and small and no place to relax. Breakfast is nice, clean and good quality, but no cut vegetables or cut fruit. The whole family missed tomatoes, cucumbers, paprika, grapes, melon and other good stuff for your body.....If you want more than toast, cheese, ham and jelly, eat out. Fitness room is very small, but ok for cycling and weight lifting. Two out of four nights there were a private party in the pool/bar and therefore, we felt a bit pushed out. We had to leave the pool and that is not what we paid for. We stayed in this hotel mainly because of the pool and the hotel is not very cheap...So; Hotel Management: First take care of your paying guests and then make an income of hiring the place out to others. The private cab to JFK was the best thing ever though! Good driver, traffic jam, and hot. Thanks to him we got on our plane to Europe in time! Thank you driver! It was really worth 60 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: motorwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days/three nights while we were in town for a dance performance. This hotel is right in the middle of EVERYTHING! Our room was on the tenth floor - room was extremely clean, novel decor. Our daughter was on the fifth floor and did not experience the noise levels discussed in other reviews.The staff was friendly and attentive - we even received a phone call on our check out day inquiring if we needed transportation or a luggage cart. Pool area was clean and inviting. Lounge had a great party atmosphere. We would definitely stay here again! We will most certainly tell friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChestnutSligo
Reviews.Content: Very nice cllean bedrooms, air con and free wifi. The pool is small (a spa pool) but very refreshing on a hot day

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachdame84
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in NYC... Beautiful decor, a really fun atmosphere and the location is incredible. Its literally half a block from times square. But the best part is the cheap price! We spent most of our time having a blast at the pool/nightclub.. We never wanted to leave!! I can't wait to go back and highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about staying.

Reviews.Title: “Merely a club which happens to have hotel rooms above it. Nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: armanis500
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend which was supposed to be a romantic stay in the heart of Times Square. Other than the location being convenient, I don't have any other good things to say of this hotel. Management here seems to be more focused on running a club rather than a hotel. While staying less than two days, I encountered three incidents which left me very dissatisfied. First, when we were in need of a towel, we called the lobby requesting some. A card states to leave your old towels by the door to receive new ones. Within minutes the old towels were gone but never received any new ones. After some time, we called again asking for the towels which we were told "they're on the way". After about 45 minutes, we ran out of patience and were forced to dry ourselves with a hand towel. Finally after coming home hours later we see that our room was cleaned and towels replaced. Then we requested for a dress to be dry cleaned. We were told we couldn't leave it with the concierge and had to return to our room to fill out a form instead. We were already running late and they still wouldn't hold the dress for us. In addition, there was never any form at our room to begin with! We skipped that process and proceeded with our night. Finally, after returning later that evening we asked for a form to request the dry cleaning service again. We did not ask for overnight service, and were told the regular time would have the dress back by 7pm which was fine. The fee, as stated on the form, was to be $23. We had the dress returned to us at about noon and were actually impressed with the service.. so we thought. Upon checkout, we were in need of catching a train and needed to check out quickly. We were told we had to wait because the "computers were down". After making us late and causing us to wait longer, they finally had the nerve to charge us $45 or the dry cleaning. Since I didn't have time to waste, I showed how disgusted I was with the charge yet paid just to be on my way. Which then came to $49 after tax. So altogether, $50 to simply dry clean a dress. I was referred to this hotel because of its uniqueness and location, though I wouldn't return here in the future nor would I suggest anyone else who is looking for decent service in return for the $250 nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestMonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights beginning on Sunday July 17th. Had no idea I was this close to Times Square (a mere half block). I was welcomed early in the morning and my luggage was stored until I came back. Front desk Clerk on Sunday morning was beyond sweet, gracious and I knew right then and there what a great stay it would be. when I returned at five and heard the pool party I knew I had arrived. Had a great CLEAN wonderful room on the eleventh floor. After traversing the city I could not wait to come back to my room, the "rain shower" and it's closeness to everything. I will recommend this place to everyone and WILL BE BACK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great party hotel, close to times square!”
Reviews.Author: mirlockfer
Reviews.Content: Great swimming pool and sauna, with bar until the wee hours. Close to metro and times square, a great place to stay during a citytrip

Reviews.Title: “Tottally modern!”
Reviews.Author: leaper22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room mate grace for 5 nights when in NYC. Our room was totally modern, but very small! Our neighbors the first night were very loud, but when we called the front desk they were very helpful and sent up security. The pool was fantastic after a hot day in the city! The location was perfect, and the staff were great! The wifi is very unreliable, even the front desk said so. But, their is a Starbucks across the street that we used for internet. Overall, our stay was great, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Tj7777
Reviews.Content: I must that I stayed at a lot of hptels in NYC but this by far was the best one that I ever stayed at. The location is GREAT and the service was Great as well. The pool is small but for some reason it seems to be just a perfect fit for the hotel. I stayed during the 4th of July weekend. The pool party was GREAT and the pool stay open 24hrs which is GREAT. I will say that I think this will be the ONLY hotel that I am going to stay at everytime I visit NYC. The only thing that I didn't like was I asked for a late check out at 2:00pm and they told me anything after 1:30pm will result in a half day charge. I would understand if the hotel was full or sold out or something but when I ask they said that they was not full at all.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but pretty cool design hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsamuelson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely hip with a swimming pool in the lobby, trendy wall paper and modern design. But even for New York the rooms are small! I mean matchbox size. It's okay for a maximum stay of about 3 nights, but any longer and you will be bouncing off the walls! Staff were lovely, breakfast yummy, and location is fantastic as you are only a stone's throw from Times Square. Price is fair for New York, although check for specials. I recommend, but for short stays only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff but Dirty, Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirtualMR
Reviews.Content: On the positive side - convenient location, nice staff, comfortable bed On the negative side - dirty room, forgot to clean, construction next door, loud nightclub on ground floor. The ultimate gross-out was when someone came down to complain that there were hairs in his bed. Filthy hotel. Not set up for business travelers either.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Hanrahb
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived this place was great, friendly staff, seamless checking in process. Our room was superb a huge bed, seating area bathroom was big enough to accommodate 2 people moving around very easily. Coming back from a long day wondering around the city to the amazing swimming pool and sauna was brilliant way to start off the evening. The location was amazing definitely try out Connollys bar a couple of doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyRockit
Reviews.Content: When staying in NYC the big issue is always, always room size. Outside of the Mandarin Oriental, the Peninsula and the like -- hotel rooms are smallish compared to many other major city - and certainly US cities. The 5 Start hotels are gonna break your budget and are only for those with lavish expense accounts or considerable means. Myself, I always seek out the quirky, boutique hotels - I generally appreciate the decor, ambiance and experience more. In this regard, I don't think the Grace disappoints. Taxes included (which are substantial in NYC) was $290/night for 4 nights. If your hotel is under the $250-300 range in NYC your experience is likely to be crappy and disappointing. The Grace's rooms are "smallish" - -but larger than rooms I've had at the Hudson (tiny!!!!), Paramount, Time, Night, Tribeca Grand, Thompson and SoHo Grand hotels -- and for the price, I think a real value. They are well designed and thought-out. Plenty of space for storage. I stayed in a corner room and the bed was raised on a platform with generous storage beneath for luggage. The linens, pillows and comforter were plush and comfy. Framed by windows on the head and side of the bed, the room actually had a light and airy feel. Decor is otherwise minimalist, but functional. Everything was clean and in working order. Bathroom is exceptionally roomy -- although I stayed alone on this trip, the bathroom had a double sink with an expansive 8 foot counter -- plenty of room to spread out your necessities, even with a traveling companion. No bath, but the shower was enormous, an open plan design separated only by a curtain from the rest of the bathroom. Bit of a problem with the heavy shower spray not draining fast enough and water pooling and inching out of the shower inclosure - but not really a big deal. As noted, the lobby/bar of the hotel also has an indoor pool floating at "eye-level", and at night it's a small club of sorts -- DJ, loud music, etc. -- very youngish crowd. It's a lively scene -- I didn't hear a peep of noise in my room on the 8th floor, but maybe it's an issue if you're on a lower floor. I'm not sure who the hotel's base clientele is -- looked a bit fashion and a lot of younger, European tourists. I tried it because of my familiarity with the Roommate hotels in Madrid, Spain (and a friend has decorated them all - so disclosure there). Staff completely professional and friendly, absolutely no issues -- didn't give it a 5 star because it's simply not a 5-star hotel, but I thought given the location and comfort, it's an excellent value for what it is and you'll not likely be disappointed. A particularly good location for first timers to NYC who will do all the traditional touristy things.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in a great hotel at a great price!e”
Reviews.Author: missejb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel grace for 4 nights in may 2011 for my birthday. I was amazed by the location.. Less than a Minute walk and you are on times square. When we arrived the staff were really helpful.. Especially Ronaldo lovely guy! No problems with any of the staff always friendly polite and smiling. I had researched the hotel before we booked so i was aware of the crazy pool parties in the bar area so this was not a problem for me and my friend. Although i did hear someone complain about the music. So if you prefer the quiet life then maybe hotel grace isn't the place for you to stay! We had room 10 on the 10th floor which was great. The rooms are small but the space is used very well. Really comfortable bed with i pod docking station Flat screen tv and dvd player. Wet room style bathroom with complimentary Toiletries. Only complaint being the water pressure in the shower. Not being very strong. You get free wifi in your room but being on the 10th floor the signal was very weak so i used my notebook in the lobby! Overall i had a great stay and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Small but fun!”
Reviews.Author: RachL84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Roommate Grace for a few nights when my friends visited, even though I lived in New York City. It was a great time. Although rooms are small, they are well furnished, clean and modern. The pool area, saunas and bar area give it a club-like feel every night, though I imagine that if you stayed on the first several floors the music would keep you up all night!

Reviews.Title: “grace is very cool!”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: First time to New York & we wanted to be close enough to the action yet still have a quiet place to retreat back to & Room Mate Grace ticked all the boxes. It is around the corner from Times Square & only a few minutes walk to the Rockafella centre. The hotel is very new & housed in an old renovated building. The look is very modern, quirky & funky. Our room was small but comfortable & designed well & the bathroom was of average size. However the price paid for the room reflected great value for this part of the city. The indoor pool was a nice touch however it seemed a bit cold when we jumped in, maybe just a technical glitch? All staff we came accross were very helpful, happy & informative. This is a great hotel within the Times Square district.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT !!!”
Reviews.Author: tatishapiro
Reviews.Content: i went to the hotel for my 4 year wedding anniversary. It was perfect!! awesome pool, excellent breakfast with many choices , gym and great staff. The hotel walking distance to times square, shopping and tourist attractions. The room itself is great trust me if u could take the bed home you would it truly amazing! Also it was peaceful very quiet. The room is clean and great detail. We love the fact we can adjust the AC in the room .My husband loved there was a ipod dock because he forgot his iphone charger so the ipod dock was a life saver. So if you are thinking to come to NYC RM Grace hotel is the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “30 In Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: blitz18
Reviews.Content: Booked the Room Mate Grace hotel for my 30th Birthday for one week having looked on trip adviser for the hotel i was really please when i finally arrived with my husband. The flights was with British Airways and were comfortable and onece at the other end we paid 12 dollas each to get on the bus which takes you to your nearest point near your hotel, ours was about a ten minute walk away from the hotel which was fine. We managed to find Room mate Grace down a side turning which was a ten minute walk from time square which was amazing. Such a fantastic city alot like London and easy to find places due to the block system. Arrived at the hotel and as soon as you walk in the staff are friendly and welcoming and were so helpful. The hotel was very clean and looked very smart considering it was a threee star i have stayed in five stars that were not up to this standards. once in our room i was surprised that i could not hear that much noise as we were facing the front of the road. the bed was so comfortable one of the best i have ever slept in and lovely fluffy pillow which is what you want when you do a walking tour. The bedroom was small but there was enough space for me and my husband and it was cosy and very clean. the shower was always hot and very smart. We had a petite room which over looked the main road at the front and even though we were next to a pub we herd the music once but nothing that ear plugs didnt keep out. we had booked to have breakfast in the hotel and it was a continental breakfast which was all fresh and plenty of food , the seating area was comfortable and clean and again the staff in the restaurant were so friendly and helpful, never had to wait to get a seat and it over looked the pool area which was amazing and a plus for a NYC hotel. I really cant recommend this hotel enough it was for me an amazing holiday in NYC and enjoyed and loved every part of it. The room had an ipod dock which was also an alarm which came in handy in your room, the hotel also had internet acess in the lobby. I visited many attractions while here and managed to do a list of things while in the Big Apple. i would highly recommend would be NYC tours it was one of the most amazing trips i had ever done on any holiday i have been on. This included a private tour guide who was amazing and had fantastic knowledge on the city i managed to take the sub way the bus and go to Harlem and see the real New York, we walked to many parts of NYC and foun this amazing and made it easy for us to find our way around the city throughout our holiday. We had dumplings in china town and got a real insight of how New yorker live!, this was amazing this tour was about Â£350.00 but was truly worth the whole experience our tour guide was Lawrence who lived in Queens and we literally walked from 10 am till 6.30 pm that night it was amazing we saw the whole of the city and was more than we could have ever have dreamed of. WE also went on the staten island ferry didnt go up to the statue of liberty but was not really fussed about doing so, u can see it really close on the ferry and go quiet near it to. We also went to the Rockerfella centre and done top of the rock and went up to the empire state building the views were amazing. i can not wait to revist the city as its a place where i could visit time and time again, i was quiet disapointed with the shopping especially woodbury common i did manange to get some DKNY jeans for six pound each which was amazing but the clothing was very american . Also found that the designer shoes were cheaper in london than here even though the uggs were alot cheaper here than in london. I would highly recommend this hotel and the tours this was an amazing experience, we ate in an italian called Bella Vita which was just off of times square it was cheap huge portions friendly staff and always got you a table was something out of good fellas the best pizza and italian i have had ate here every day pratically for dinner it was so lovely. The hotel had a resident dj playing melow house music which was amazing and had old black and white films on the screen while you were swimming , it also had a steam room and a sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Downright Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: db70disco
Reviews.Content: Listen people if you are expecting big luxurious rooms just steps from Time's Square be prepared to spend more than $250 a night. These rooms are very small and I knew that going in. If you want a clean cheap place to stay that is literally a few steps from Time's Square then you've found it. For those of you who maybe aren't getting the picture this place is sort of like staying on a super modern boat that doesn't move. The rooms are basically a bed and a small closet and you have to walk through the shower area to use the toilet. So they are SMALL, if that's not ok with you, you should stay somewhere else. As a solo business traveler this place was a perfect place for a night or two. I wouldn't want to stay here for a week with my wife, it's too small I also wouldn't want to stay here with kids. If you just need a place to crash after meetings or out on the town in Manhattan it's great. They have a very friendly, muti-lingual staff, clean rooms, a nice pool and modern funky decor. If you are just passing through for a night or two I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fun in the middle of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: momonbusiness
Reviews.Content: You'll know you're in nyc if you stay here. It's funky and modern. Well designed so the rooms feel more spacious than they are. We loved the pool (in the lobby, it feels a little like being in a fish tank) and the steam room and sauna - things you don't usually find in nyc hotels. Work out room is small, but looks out on Times Square. Fabulous location. We really enjoyed it. Just do not, not, not let them put you in a room facing 45th St (at least on the lower floors). It's too loud to sleep. Other parts of the hotel are surprisingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Different and Fun”
Reviews.Author: rjkaufman
Reviews.Content: If you're tired of the same old hotel then this is worth a shot. Our deluxe room was spacious for an NY hotel, and the location in New York was perfect for city sightseeing. But be warned: the bathroom is not what you are used to- the shower shares the floor with the rest of the bathroom, including the toilet- yes, the shower, toiler, and sinks are all in the same small room. It was kind of novel I suppose, but not that practical. Other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: bestcoastpunk
Reviews.Content: Service was fairly standard. I haven't had much interaction with the staff so I can't comment much in that regard. Room is ok. Bed is nice but carpet is worn down, furniture is cheap, and wallpaper is pealing. Overall the room is a little nicer than a national franchise but sub-par compared to other boutique hotels. "Gym" is minimal and is best suited to females doing Pilates or similar workouts. Only two stationary bikes and no free weights over 10kg/20lbs. Bars are sub-par. Both upper and lower bars attempted to pass Johnnie Walker Red off as Jameson. The DJ and ability to drink in the pool are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, really good value for central NYC!”
Reviews.Author: NiJo_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with another two friends, in a room with 4 beds in it (which is difficult to find in NYC at a reasonable cost!)! As we were not planning to be in the hotel room a lot, as we were in NYC after all, I can not fault the cleaniness of the rooms as well as how comfortable the beds were! The location was amazing, Times "Square" at the end of the block, with 5th Ave a short stroll away. Lovely "French" cafe on 44th street - un, deux, trois - reasonably priced for brunch. Considering its location, it was very quiet (we were on the 5th floor) and we slept very well. The bathroom is frustrating from a design perspective (agree that the water pressure wasn't exactly blowing us away!), and why they didn't just put a wall up between the bedroom and the shower/toilet is beyond me! However, put it this way, just recommended this to a work colleague as a great, value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyes our stay”
Reviews.Author: Grantsdad
Reviews.Content: Weekend trip ( 2 nights) with wife and son Grant(6years old) and daughter Grace(20 months) had super time. Thought maybe it was a more adult hotel and would they would frown on small children when we booked. But employess were super social and helpful and great to children. Myself and son tried pool one evening before nightly party started, son was thrilled. The rooms were small but children loved the rooms because of bunkbeds and little flatscreens. Continental breakfast was worth price. Super close to Times Square and Toys r Us for children was a real plus. Only negative was view, we were only a few floors up from street. But overall we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, quiet with added bonus of celebrity sighting!”
Reviews.Author: Tassiestyle
