Reviews.Content: Central location less than a block from Times Square but our room was amazingly quiet. Decent sized room for NYC. Only downside was poor water pressure in shower and intermittent wifi reception. Bed extremely comfortable. Excellent cafe next door, Cranberry Cafe, with fresh buffet food at all ours - spotted Richard Gere coming out of a trailer outside the cafe on our last morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Canefudge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for new years eve. Its steps away from times square. Very nice accommodations, rooms a bit small but to be expected in nyc. Great indoor pool and lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Style on a budget”
Reviews.Author: a_travel_monkey
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Grace is a budget boutique hotel located very close to Times Square, and was surprisingly not noisy, but this might be down to being on the 7th floor. I stayed in a deluxe room in a corner of the building (but unfortunately the room was not that bright). The bed was raised and comfortable, allowing you to store your luggage underneath it. The only difference between this and a standard room appears to be the fact that some Deluxe rooms have a king size bed and may be a bit bigger. The other furniture in the room consisted of a small round table (which was moveable) and a chair, and wardrobe space was included behind a curtained area. The bathrooms are a bit different to other hotels, with the sink accompanied by a large counter top, and is not closed off from the rest of the room. There was a waterfall shower in a spacious booth (there are no bathtubs in the hotel) and a toilet which share a sliding door (separated from the sink). The bathroom amenities were: bath gel, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, soap, shower cap, shoe shine, bath robes and hair dryer. Other amenities include an empty fridge, an iPod dock and a safe large enough to store a laptop. Additionally, you can control the temperature with an electronic thermostat. NB, there is no room service or tea/coffee making facilities, although the room guide does have some suggested restaurants nearby. There is free wifi, but there were no guides on how to use this (I spent some time guessing which of the wifi networks was there's (it's the roomlinx one). For those of you travelling without a wifi device, there are 2 PCs in the lobby, but you have to pay for access. There is also a small gym on the first floor alongside a steam room and sauna. I did use the sauna, but the controls weren't very clear so I couldn't adjust the heat level and there were no instructions on how to initiate the steam room. Beware that the "free breakfast" is not included with all rates, which is confusing as when you visit their website, it suggests that it is free, but maybe you only get it if you book directly through their website rather than via an online travel website. There is a Starbucks across the road, or a deli literally a few doors down which sells hot breakfast items (which aren't included at the hotel). I didn't interact much with the staff except at check-in and the person was friendly and explained the amenities of the hotel clearly. All in all, it was a comfortable stay in the thick of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel and good price for central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Amy001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the hotel was perfect. It is really trendy and the rooms are very well decorated with a clever use of space (compact but functional). There are lots of nice touches like good quality towels and bed clothes. The location was perfect, literally a couple of hundred yards from Time Square. The pool party was a bit of an unusual feature of the hotel - very quirky, and not to everyone's taste (not ours anyway!) but it still looked like good fun. The hotel info in the room described the breakfast as complimentary - we didnt think breakfast was included, so after reading that we had breakfast, which was very good. However at check out they charged us for it, but when i explained that i had read that it was complimentary, they immediately removed it from our bill. We had a brilliant stay at room mate grace and we'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great central location near times square and the subway. Rooms were clean and comfortable - although we had to change rooms as we had booked a queen room and were given two singles. The staff in general were not very helpful - and when we wanted a taxi to the airport, we were told the normal cabs were metered and would be $65-70, so we were booked a private taxi for $60. The driver, I felt, was a friend of the staff member when he arrived. As we drove to the airport, we went past a NYC taxi which said 'Manhattan to JFK - flat rate $45'.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this funky, contemporary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elliel777
Reviews.Content: When we first found out that this was a boutique hotel, we were concerned about how small it would be, but there was plenty of room for the 4 of us (we have 2 young children). We would not recommend that children younger than ages 6 sleep on the top bunks as they are pretty high up. Our particular room had 4 separate beds, 2 in an "L" shape below and 2 bunks above. The beds were comfy and we each had our own small TV's! Great utilization of space in the room, however, we wished there were towel bars along the counters as well outside the shower stalls. The toilet stall is in a separate room besides the shower and that was the only place that contained 2 wall hooks. A few more hooks would've been great. One negative we did experience was how the heating system worked. The vent is situated right above the bunks. The 2 beds beside the window were always cold as it appeared to be coming from the windows. So we cranked up the heat, but it took so long to activate that by the time the heat came around, the kids were super hot (as they were sleeping in the bunks) and the ladder railing was burning hot! Like all the other reviews I've read on this hotel, the location is great, the breakfast is fabulous (much more than we expected....diff types of juices, fresh fruits, cereals, hard boiled eggs, real non-processed cheeses, deli meats, diff types of breads/bagels, donuts, mini muffins, milk and there is even a specialty coffee machine)! The breakfast items is always very fresh and very nicely presented. We travelled with a total of 21 people (5 families) in which there were 11 kids (ages 6 to 13). They loved the heated pool that was situated very uniquely beside the hotel bar and lobby. There is also a nice seating area where you can watch the kids while they swim. There is also a sauna and steam room (quite a fair size), which we did not unfortunately get to use as we were there for only 3 nights. The staff is all very nice and helpful (esp Patrick, who helped put all of our luggages in storage as we were too early to check into our rooms). Loved the location as it is very close to Times Square. Loved that fact that there was also free internet as well! Overall, we had a great experience with this hotel and would definitely recommend it to all of our friends (and we already have)! We know where to stay the next time we return to the Big Apple! Thanks, Room Mate Grace!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lana155
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I really enjoyed staying at your hotel. Everything (and I mean, everything) about our stay was wonderful. The front desk people were very friendly- really friendly, not just trying to smile for customers. I can see the difference. Our room was out of this world! The breakfast is included, and it was very good! You can use the gym, sauna and a pool, which is awesome! I am recommending this hotel to anyone. The added bonus - it's two minutes walk from Times Square. Perfect location! Oh, and did I mention the free internet? Loved it, loved it, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky room and FAB location!”
Reviews.Author: lucyp40
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed for five nights. We enjoyed our stay - AFTER moving out of our third floor room on day number two due to noise from the pool area under us. After we made our room change, we had to have our key reprogramed almost every day which was a bit of a pain as the front desk area is small and doesn't take too many guests to be very congested. Otherwise, the location is excellent - within walking distance of almost every tourist "must see" destination!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, But Know What to Expect”
Reviews.Author: smeyler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Times Square in mid-town. We recently stayed over in a bunk bed room with two 8 year old kids. The space is tight, but very funky and surprisingly comfortable. It would be very tight for 4 adults, but good friends could make it work. The hotel is very European feeling, which makes sense since it is Spanish owned. Almost all of the guests were European (Italy, Germany, Spain mostly). Breakfast, $10, is typically European and pretty good value. Some of the complaints addressed below: - Room Size: It is NYC, rooms are small. Plus, it is very cheap. Deal with it or book a large chain, pay more, and get less style or location. We were a family of four and were more than comfortable. Kids loved it. I wouldn't want to be there for 2 weeks, but for a night or two it is great. - Staff: OK, Front Desk was pretty inept. But, overall everyone else was helpful and nice. They are a little understaffed at check in, etc. and rooms are not typically available early. Be patient, it is still a deal for NYC. - Noise: there is a rollicking disco/night club scene that happens here on Weekends and select weeknights. Some of the stuff that goes on is a bit nuts. If you are a prude, go elsewhere. It does get noisy though, so a room higher up is much better. - Overall: very funky find in mid-town NYC. I am a local and have stayed all over NYC in many different hotels. I thought this was a great deal if you are looking for funk and style on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: oasis1180
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean, modern and beautiful. Personnel is very friendly and helpful. Great location - only half a block from Times Square. Breakfast did not include hot entrees but still was very nice. Wonderful hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: khaled074
Reviews.Content: This Hotel made our first stay together in Manhattan really memorable. The front desk were helpful and the location is amazing. The rooms are small, but well spaced, cosy and very clean. also inside there is a club downstairs that we did not check out, but it kept the hotel lively. there is a pool on the Mezzanine which you could see from the lobby, which made you want to jump in! definately worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently while travelling with a female friend on a girl's trip to New York. We arrived early in the morning from a long haul flight. We had a warm welcome from the receptionist who found a room for us that enabled us to check in early. Service was prompt and friendly. Our room was clean and modern. It couldn't be described as spacious, but this is New York. There was room underneath the bed to stow large suitcases. We had lots of natural light in our room on the 12th floor. The bathroom setup with the sliding door, shower, toilet and sink being sperated worked perfectly for us. Free wi-fi was fast and reliable. The price was perfect. We didn't opt for breakfast. We had it most mornings at Starbucks across the road which, depsite the long queues, served customers promptly (and has free wifi). We had no issues with noise. We could hear sirens in the evening, but this is to be expected with the location of this hotel. The bed was very comfortable (and I'm fussy with beds) and had two comfortable pillows. The ipod docking station would play music, but should be noted that it doesn't charge an iphone, so still bring your charger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julirabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a concert at the Best Buy theater. What a cool hotel! Great location, friendly and helpful staff and you can't beat the 24 hour pool! Comfortable beds and clean rooms with funky decor. Definetly would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in New York”
Reviews.Author: Frigu7
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel... 1 min from Time Square, 5 from Subway. The rooms are really nice and concerning the noise, we had maybe 1 night were we heard something but this did not come from the party room on the first floor but well from outside. Besides that, I would really recommand this place! The only negative point I would mention is that instead of booking a ride back from the hotel to the airport (75$ for a "special" taxi), just go outside and wave to a regular taxi for which you would pay 20$ less!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and hip rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mayaindira
Reviews.Content: i stayed in New York with my friends last year and we stayed at this hotel, and it was really amazing. It's small but cozy and hip at the same time. The swimming pool is really cool. The breakfast was delicious nothing to complain about. The room was small but very clean and the closet was big enough to fit all my shopping bags. I definetly advise you to choose this hotel, i'd surely go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, stylish, GREAT location and value”
Reviews.Author: BEMMW
Reviews.Content: Although the room was tiny, it accommodated three of us (partner and teenager) comfortably and was stylish enough so we didn't feel too cramped. LOVED the wallpaper and bunk bed lay out. Terrific value for NY -- and just two blocks from the theater where we saw a show that night. Good continental breakfast in the morning. Very European feel to the place.

Reviews.Title: “the Service is not included in here.........”
Reviews.Author: smoscone
Reviews.Content: Staied for a week for business purpose, hade many issues with the Front Desk , they forgott to wake me up for 2 times , they gave me a very small room , even that I mentioned them that I was staing for a week and my business partner got a larger room that he staied only for one night . I ask for a Limo service asking if was possible to charge to Hotel bill, they say , yes and then at the end of the service they say no . On my departure day , after booking my car transfer with them and told them that I was going to check out at around 13.00 pm , they phoned me at 12.05 to tell me that the room check out was at 12.00 and they couldn't find any note on my car pick up. Good Luck .................

Reviews.Title: “There is no service at all”
Reviews.Author: rafelsanchez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights, none of which our air condition function, we asked for maintainance since the first day. It was the last day that smebody showup, to tell us that the sensor was so close to the window that even the blower was working, it will not cooled the room because the sensor felt that the room was cooled already. So every morning during our vacations we get up at 7am, not because we want, but because of the street noise. To make it worst, one of the walls in the shower was a window, we have to get the cristal fogged , so people in the other building don't see us naked. About the conceirge, to be honest they don't have one. We payed for the epensived room in the upper floors, we wasted our money. Even we complained about this situation the hotel didnt do anything.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: clemlon
Reviews.Content: The welcome was very nice, the room very clean, the breakfast was excellent, The hotel decoration is just great. I contacted the reception for restaurant recommendation and shuttle services and was well advised.I am visiting New York every 3 or 4 months and will book this hotel for sure again next time.

Reviews.Title: “surpassed all expectations!! (and i'm hard to please)”
Reviews.Author: sera604
Reviews.Content: location: on 45th street between 6 and 7th ave, honestly nothing went wrong! literally 5 minute walk to times square! nice and close to the pharmacy duane reade and wallgreens/cvs which was super useful at night time for snacks/drinks/water. there's a starbucks on 45th about 2 minutes as well! the subway 42nd times square takes about 6 minutes to walk to - very very convenient. value: super worth it. i managed to find a deal including breakfast for 150/night! size: true it was a little small, but everything in new york is so you adjust. it was big enough for all of us. there's enough room for luggages - slide them under the bed. toilet is good size. shower too. and there's a full length mirror too. plenty of room in the beds too! noise: we had the king bed with the twin bunk on top on the 4th floor. even tho i requested to stay above the 5th floor secondary to noise, i was told with this layout of beds, the 4th floor was the highest. anyway, it wasn't so loud to the point of not being able to sleep. quite faint music that died around 2am - we were all late sleepers so it didn't both us! cleanliness: i read pretty much every review of nyc hotels from #100 down to #1 - i am super SUPER picky with cleanliness (i have somewhat of a germ issue). and let me tell you this...this hotel surpassed ALL my standards...i showered barefoot (!) and walked on the carpets comfortably. the bedsheets were crisp clean white and smelt brand new. the mattress was fine - didn't feel like someone else had slept there. no dust. no 'bits' on the floor. no stains on the mirror. no hair left in drains. no stains on the toilet. it was literally perfect - every day. other stuff: def hotel catered for the younger generation - the club downstairs should tell you everything! pool is amazing. must go. sauna, and steam room are excellent! towels supplied downstairs. the hotel doesn't have a kettle so u need to go buy ur own (hence having wallgreens close was plus plus!). the shampoo/conditioner/body wash/body cream are usable/ok quality! breakfast was included for us. it was great! mind you if you are after the hot breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, etc etc...this isn't the type. the selection doesn't change every day. you get bagels, croissants, donuts, mini cupcakes (lemon and poppyseed was good!), along with your usual condiments of jam, honey. there's also ham, and turkey, boiled egg, and cheese. also selection of fruit: red and green apples, banana and oranges. drinks were great - you can get it in a take away container as well which was perfect for us as we'd drop by before leaving the hotel. there's all types of coffee from the machine, and a huge selection of teas - peppermint, chamomile, green tea, english, earl gray, etc. the weird shower curtain is a bit of an issue but honestly, it really doesn't matter after the first night. when you've stayed for a week, the location of the hotel...the service...cleanliness, etc etc...looking back the shower curtain doesn't even raise alarm bells! service was perfectly fine with us. spoke respectfully, very helpful and check in/out was a breeze! there's free wifi in your room too - BIG plus as to why i chose this place actually! all in all i had a great 9 night stay here. i would definitely stay here again if i came back to visit - and i'm pretty sure i will!

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, priced well, needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: arynell
Reviews.Content: This was a cute hotel with some nice amenities. Staff were very friendly. Primary complaints are related to trouble getting a good night sleep due to the refrigerator door not having a tight seal resulting in the light going on and off throughout the night, the lower floor room having a lot of street noise, and a strange turn signal-like sound coming from either the door or something above the door.

Reviews.Title: “Mother and Daughter Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: kevlizmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 11yo daughter one weekend. Great location. Rooms small but very clean. We stayed in a standard room with two twin beds. Although the toilet was separated from the rest of the room by a door, the shower was only separated from the rest of the room with a shower curtian. Only one chair and a small table to sit at in the room which was OK because my daughter liked to lounge on her bed. This place must have a reputation with the 20 somethings. The pool, with wet bar, was hopping when we returned to the hotel late Sat. night. My daughter said it looked like Jersey Shore. There was a party going on on our floor also but it wasn't so disturbing we couldn't get to sleep. And hey, I used to be 20 something too and have fond memories of those days. Breakfast was $10 pp, if I had known beforehand it was no longer free we would have eaten elsewhere. But, the coffee was good, food fresh and there was variety. The front desk sells beer, wine, candy and soda which was very reasonably priced. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Mid-Town Neuvo-Mod Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LilTravelGirl1813
Reviews.Content: A small, hidden hotel-face on 45th, Room Mate Grace's advertisements bragged of being a "best kept secret" of mid-town lodging...and they weren't kidding! The hotel may look small on outward appearance, but the hotel is anything but! Upon entrance, one is met with a neuvo-mod style reminiscent of the European Spanish culture. The wallpaper and decor are busy, but it works! It certainly appeals to the stylish culture of NYC. We stayed on the 11th floor, and this was probably the worst feature of the hotel...the decor or that particular level. Each floor has it's own unique style...all very London 50's-esque...like walking into an Austin Powers movie, yet all are very tastefully done...except for the 11th floor it seems. Just a warning, if anyone is extremely drunk and dizzy, stepping out onto the 11th will definitely cause one to upchuck from the sheer and unbelievably bright, obnoxious and busy print of the walls. But once past that, the entrance into the premium rooms (the largest of all accommodations) are well worth it. Studio layout, the rooms are spacious, stylish and very clean. Again, as the lobby is, the rooms are very fitting for that modern city lifestyle, and if one truly wants to feel immersed in the NYC flavor, this hotel does convict one accordingly. Check out the brand "Custo Barcelona" because the rooms seem as if they are a spin-off of this clothing style. Some of the downfalls were the parking...parking is very affordable...$25 per night (great rate in the city), but the parking facilities are located one block over from the restaurant. Also, don't rely on the bellhop to bring your suitcases to your room. This particular position is short staffed, so it's more efficient to bring your bags to the room. Since most reservations come with the complimentary breakfast, don't take that as a complement. The breakfast was limited, as it was just complimentary, but the cold cuts and cheeses are comparable to those found in the cheese section of your local food market where the individually wrapped cheeses are a staple here. Other that that, this hotel would certainly be the place of a nice little getaway

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1685
Reviews.Content: JUST AMAZING. The Room Mate Grace Hotel is an amazing gem in the heart of Times Square. At 45th and Broadway, it had everything you need for a comfortable and affordable stay! Breakfast was great - Bagels, juices, coffee, croissants, mini donuts, cereal, cheese and meat to make sandwiches. The bathroom was a little different, but not as bad as I thought it would be! Showers could have had a little more pressure, but can't win them all. Also, ZERO issues with hot water! Beds were unbelievably comfortable (NO BED BUGS!) and sheets were clean and fresh! If you don't want them cleaning your room early, make sure you put the DND sign on the door before you go to bed! Had a petite room, not the biggest, but there is storage under the bed for suitcases and the room STILL had a queen bed. TV's and DVD players in the room, along with iHomes (unfortunately ours did not work). Pool area is GREAT during the day if you are looking for a casual swim, however gets busier at night. Get a room above the 5th floor if you don't want to hear music from the bar downstairs. We were on the 11th floor, no problems at all! Also, Free Wi-Fi!! Only gripe would be the front desk staff wasn't the friendliest, however that was the only problem we had!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, shame about the corkscrew...”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandJames
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel highly to my friends as the location is ideal, however if my mother asked I would suggest she stay somewhere with more of a hotel experience. The room was spacious considering we are in the heart of NYC and provided all the usual benefits. We are having a great time and the hotel is in easy reach from anywhere in the city. The only issue we have is trying to open a bottle of wine we bought from the front desk yesterday, whenever we have asked fir a corkscrew we get a blank look or told the opening times of the bar. If you provide a cork bottle to your guests it should not be a trial for them to open the damn thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Facility, Service Decent”
Reviews.Author: tamcorp04
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, and the facility is really nice. If you want a big room, you might be disappointed but we weren't there to sleep so it was just cozy for us (my girlfriend and myself). The hotel is unlike any place I'd ever stayed before and exudes energy and a party atmosphere. My only problem was our batteries to our remote didn't work and we couldn't get them to replace them. We dealt with it just fine. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Swerve TGI's!”
Reviews.Author: Greenie04
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's bang in the centre next to Times Sq and is close to all the shopping facilities on 5th Avenue. Bit of a trek to Downtown but you can't have it all! The breakfast was made up of essence bagels and mini doughnuts/muffins so no gripes there. The pool area looked cool though we didn't fully utilise those facilities. Room was ok but nothing more - the ensuite was pretty good though and the cleanliness was to a good standard. Reception staff seemed a little cold toward us and weren't particularly helpful but all in all a nice stay - the bed was v. comfy! Top tip though - though it's literally on your doorstep don't eat in Times Square - we did twice and hugely regretted it - especially TGI Fridays - big no no!

Reviews.Title: “DisGRACE of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eswaslike
Reviews.Content: So we check in and the woman at the front desk was useless. She basically didnt know anything about anything and was completely rude on top of it. Next morning we ask for late checkout and leave to go get breakfast. We come back to the room only to find out that something has been stolen. The housekeeper said shes been in the room for a half hour before we got there and literally nothing was even cleaned in that time! All that was different was the fact that something was missing! We couldnt get a straight answer from anybody on staff. Each person was dumber then the next AND COMPLETELY RUDE!!! Seems that there must have been 5 people going in and out of our room for the half hour that the housekeeper was in there! Who knows which one of those random people stole it! When we ask to speak to someone everyone just looks like a deer in the headlight and would just answer us with snappy remarks which was making us more angry then the stolen item! On top of that the housekeeper threw away our garage receipts so that made it a pain to get our cars the next day!! We came to the conclusion that well never see this irreplaceable item ever again and we still had another night at this forsaken hotel. The next night they tell us they have to switch our room and the room we got had a broken heater in the dead of winter. The first room the ihome did not work, and this second room didnt even come with an ihome. Now the last morning we had at this horrible hotel we got woken up by housekeeping at 8 in the morning she just walks in! Then we get really angry and they tell us that we shouldve put the do not disturb sign on the doorknob...WELL MAYBE WE WOULDVE PUT IT ON THE DOORKNOB IF YOU HAD PROVIDED US WITH ONE! Seriously do not stay at this hotel, the do not deserve your money and they will do nothing to make you feel comfortable. A hotels staff should go above and beyond with everything not the opposite. You have the choice to stay at plenty of hotels and they should be thankful that you chose them. Instead theyd rather just give attitude and be dumb and useless. I never saw such a horrible staff in my entire life!

Reviews.Title: “should have listened to my friends before booking”
Reviews.Author: earle1231
Reviews.Content: From the get go they hotel was terrible, I sent them an email with regard to a package being delivered requesting a reply, never got it. I called and was put on hold indefinitely. I then called for the manager who had to return my call. The Mgr resolved my problem, I then wen to bed to find the TV and phone both broken and while laying naked in bed had the engineering dept in my room 4 times that evening. The next morning when exiting the elevator the Bell man ran over my foot with his cart. and it just gets better and better. We checked out and into the New Doubletree for the same price which included a full breakfast and the best cookies in the world. I would never return to Grace. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Dis-Grace Rooms”
Reviews.Author: georginamo
Reviews.Content: I havent stayed at this hotel, but felt compelled to write about my experience with them before a proposed trip. I booked a 5 night stay over New Year 2010 and had to cancel it (reluctantly) some weeks in advance due to hospital treatment which was urgent. I had the confirmation back that it was cancelled and then just before Christmas 2010 they decided to debit my account with the entire cost of the stay. I contacted both the third party (I escape who were excellent) and Room mate Grace. It was refunded 5 days later but not before I had incurred over Â£100 bank charges (unauthorised overdraft etc). Grace Rooms refused to refund the charges and didnt even bother to contact me directly, absolute disgrace. So, my advice to anyone is to think twice before booking with these unscrupulous hoteliers. If they are so rude before you go I cant imagine they are any better whilst there. I would also like ot add though that I Escape is a wonderful website and the staff there agreed to take my losses of my next booking with them (which will not be to Grace Rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Indeed”
Reviews.Author: StarbrightGirl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package deal flying out of Madrid. Booked 3 rooms for 5 people (parents, 2 brothers and myself). We got given 3 rooms together which was a start. The hotel is right by Times Square which is brilliantly central for Manhattan. It is wedged between a bunch of Irish bars. My only issue with the location - and this is completely down to personal preference - is that it is way too touristy and if you come back in the evening from a long day walking, shopping and sight-seeing, you dont really want to go too far for a beer and some food but here you are limited to the option of an $8 beer and a $15 burger which isn't so great when there are 5 hungry people staying there for a week. Looking at the hotel website this is a spanish hotel chain - all the staff are spanish speaking (apart from the cleaning staff who are all Thai I think). Rooms are nice and all different. They're not as small as people mentioned though I was told we had been upgraded (aren't we always). TVs were quite small. Shower water pressure not great. The pool is in the lobby and is tiny -never used it or the sauna as didn't have time. There would occasionally be people in there posing. Downside to pool is that the lobby and the breakfast room stink of chlorine. Despite there being no hot options available, the choice of breakfast was extensive and delicious (bagels, donuts, fruit, jam, boiled eggs, ham). Would stay again but there are nicer hotels out there and I would stay in a funkier part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Europe in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1919
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Grace definitely exceeded my expectations. My favorite part was starting each day in the delighful little breakfast room that reminded me of some of the most charming hotels I've visited in Europe ... a relaxed, social atmosphere and healthy food that filled me up but didn't make me want to go back to sleep (no vats of runny scrambled eggs or greasy sausage here). Despite the inevitable space constraints of NYC hotels, my room was somehow cozy, rather than cramped. The mattress and bedding were really comfortable and the little table or window seat were perfect for reading or working on my laptop (props for reliable wireless service too). As promised by other reviewers, every employee I encountered went out of his or her way to be welcoming and friendly, but I must note that, also as promised, housekeeping comes knocking pretty early in the morning, "do not disturb" sign or not. Aside from that, though, I would absolutely stay at Grace again, would recommend this hotel to a friend, and would look for Room Mate hotels in other cities. Way to go, Mates.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and no bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erikah999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Room Mate Grace Hotel for 5 nights in December 2010. Our stay overall was great. The location is great, right in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District! We arrived before check in and they agreed to store our bags and upgraded our room for free! The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were small, which is very typical for NYC, but were nice. The bathrooms were very odd. The shower head comes off the ceiling and there is a drain in the center of the bathroom, but there is no actual enclosed shower. There is no shower curtain or door, you just stand in the middle of the bathroom to take a shower....which took the first few showers to get used to! It was a problems b/c everything gets wet and no one can really be in the bathroom to get ready or use the bathroom while someone else is showering! The only 2 complaints we had were 1) the lighting, which was not great in the actual hotel room and getting ready and putting on make up in the bathroom was not an option until everyone was done showering and 2) the noise from the pool/club at night. The pool turns into a club at night and we were on the 4th floor and could hear the music and bass in the room every night. It went until 1-2 am every night, and on the nights we were exhausted from being on the go all day, it was slightly irritating! And the best part of our stay.....we found no evidence of bed bugs which was a HUGE relief!!! I would definitely return to Room Mate Grace and would recommend it to a friend without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great find”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute when I realized I needed to stay in the city because of the snow storm. I found the hotel on Orbitz and the internet rate was fantastic. I had not ever heard of the hotel....and was really pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square and it was modern, chic, clean and funky. The room was funky but so clean and cozy. The bed was fantastic and the bathroom was roomy and clean. I got the best night's sleep. It was well worth the money and I recommend it to anyone who likes a chic, modern boutique hotel. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: Icegirl3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, in the midst of everything! The room was very nice and modern. The continental breakfast was good and had a lot of selection, they played snazzy music too. The only thing weird were the showers in the bathroom, there was no curtain or designated area, so the entire floor was soaked and it was weird to walk through when getting ready.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE THEY STOLE FROM ME STAFF WAS RUDE LIKE NO OTHER!”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy1030
Reviews.Content: Started off with Rude check in. I come back the next day and theres a cleaning lady who tells me a manager and another person was in my room. Something I left right on the desk near the bed was straight stolen from me. When I am trying to get this solved THEY ARE SUPER SUPER RUDE LITERALLY LIKE EVERY SINGLE PERSON THAT WORKS THERE IS RUDE THEY GET NASTY WHEN THEY STOLE FROM ME! Next night they move us to another room which had a broken heater. Next for no reason the cleaning lady wakes us up at 8 o'clock in the morning knocks and walks in. Check out is not till 12 why are they waking me up to clean. I would leave a do not disturb thing but that wasnt there either. Either way at 8 in the mornign is crazy to wake someone up on vacation. Bottom line these women at the front desk are super rude should not be in service and they STOLE FROM ME WHEN I LEFT TO GET BREAKFAST and something that can't be replaced! The maid told me a manager and a few people

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - fab location”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy1977
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have travelled to New York, and the closest I have stayed to Times Square. We found the hotel to be brilliant. We had a few difficulties with our booking through the agent we used and wondered if the hotel would continue these troubles, but they were exactly aware of what had happened and check in and check out was seamless. The hotel is funky with fab wallpaper. Our room was fantastic, the biggest room I have stayed in in New York. The only thing that would have made the room better would be drawers. Breakfast was included with our stay, and this was a real plus point. Yes there is a club in the hotel, and as we were on the 6th floor we could hear some music, but it never stopped us from sleeping! We didn't use the pool, on an evening it was a bit like P Diddy's crib, with ladies in bikini's sipping cocktails, but we never expected to go to New York and use the hotel pool, we were there for the sights! And sights there are, not 20 meters from the front door is Times Square! I would definitely stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: bhwh
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NY and we were very glad that we stayed in this hotel on our first trip because of its central location - a bit of a hidden gem really. Perhaps if we visited again, we would look to stay further outside of the main 'tourist' area but for a first time in the city, it was ideal. I'll keep the review nice and simple: Pros - central location, very clean throughout entire hotel, nice small size (compared to huge inpersonal Hilton types), brilliant to have pool/sauna/steam room, very comfortable beds and bedding, interesting shop in reception to stock up mini fridge, helpful/knowledgable staff, good sized bathroom and shower (wet room) Cons - appalling wireless internet connection in certain rooms (we stayed in two different rooms - 906 had a poor connection and 1204 was excellent), rooms on smallish size for the US, bar was always closed during the day and only open one of the evenings Summary: a good quality hotel situated in an excellent location from which to explore the main attractions of NY. Fantastic facilities include a small spa; however, be careful if wifi is important to you - it may be worth swapping rooms if needed. PS. Make sure you pop around the corner to visit Jimmy's Corner on W 44th - a really good value bar with nice vibe and friendly staff. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “So Happy We Chose This One!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTwin
Reviews.Content: Only positive comments on all fronts: location, cleanliness, value, and can't say enough about the pool. Lounge was closed but the pool remained open to guests and it was wonderful. Opted for the breakfast and that was great. Parking garage across the street was a help as well, since we had a car. This place made our stay in the big apple even more special.

Reviews.Title: “WILL DEFO STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Tara026
Reviews.Content: loved this place rite in times square 1min walk bang in da middel of 2 irish pubs this hotel has a nite club if you fancy it but if you dont the rooms are all soundproof you wont here a thing. the Pool is tiny but we awernbt there for that the main thing was the staff were so help full and not the sorth of place they hang around to wait for tips which having sted in alot of hotels in the U.S sometimes its exspected well not here. If your looking for something nice down to eath and verry clean and of course times square this is 4 u. Its not overly fancy r posh but wat do you want from nyc its average size wise and yes we had the platform bed was cool and verry comfy. Cant wait to go back. for those you wondering about the toilet doors (like i was before goin and reading some reviews ) ITS A SLIDING DOOR. its fine it has a door lol

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Decent value!”
Reviews.Author: KatV1985
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews I decided to give this hotel a try! Had a great experience from the moment we arrived. We ended up taking an early flight and were worried about what we were going to do with our luggage if we couldn't check in early....well we arrived at 12:30 and check in is 3pm. They were happy to allow us to check in early, so a great start to the trip! We were on the 7th floor (glad because of the club on the main level), room was clean (no bed bugs!!!), but very small. We knew that going in though from the pictures so we did not expect a huge room. The bed was soooo comfy! The IPod dock is very convenient as we enjoy listening to music while we get ready! Location is fantastic, can't say that enough! We were steps from Times Square, 2 blocks from 5th Ave shopping, 15 min walk to Madison Square Garden, 15 min walk to Central Park, and minutes to the subway stations on 42nd and 7th (times sqaure). Took the advice of ppl on here to try the Cranberry Cafe below the hotel! It was great! Try the cheese cake!! YUMMM!

Reviews.Title: “Absoutley fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SandyRoscommon
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a hotel. Location is amazing, just a 1 minute stroll & you are onto the middle of times square. Stayed for 4 nights & will most definately be staying here whenever I do get the chance to return to New York. Staff on reception very friendly & helpful. Bed was the most comfortable one I have ever been in. Great shower, room cleaned every day. I love Room Mate Grace....

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in the heart of the city that literally never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: nichi21
Reviews.Content: Our first time in new york, and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. We made our own way to the hotel from JFK as we were on a budget. $5 for the air-train to Jamaica Station, then $2.75 for the 'E' subway to 42nd street, from there it is 3 streets downtown and 2 avenues west (in between 6th and 7th avenue). It was a busy route as it takes you through times square, so if you have a lot of luggage get a cab. The best best best thing about this hotel is the location. Turn right out of the hotel and you are at times square within seconds. Turn left and you are on 6th and minutes from the rockefellar centre. We had a petite room which was perfect for us, lot of space under the bed and a closet area. Huge shower, ipod docking station, tv and free wifi. The room is small but there is so much to be doing we hardly spent any time there so it was not an issue. Breakfast was included- continental buffet (breads, bagels, croissants, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, juice). If its included in your stay its great, if not it is not worth $10 dollars. Go to cranberry cafe (left out of hotel). Great little deli with amazingly fresh food and cheap prices. There is a pool which looks inviting but we didn't have time to fit it in with so much do to in nyc.The bar gets used by the locals in the evening. We went to the Irish bar next door which had a great atmosphere, reasonable prices and not too crowded. The staff were very polite and friendly but not overly helpful with regards to nyc. There only seemed to be one girl that knew the city and she was a gem- but doesn't work 24/7! We really couldn't have wished for a better value hotel and if we ever return to the city again we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Gingerfoody
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at the hotel November 2010. The room was clean and the bed was just the most comfortable thing ever - the maid was brilliant and more than helpful.... The decor was great and I found it very modern - we stayed on the 16th floor which is gold! The pool was great but like the other reviews would recommend staying clear at weekends when the bar/pool turned into a club... We had been asked on several occasions to show our key on returning to the hotel to prove we had a room booked. Breakfast was great and variety was brilliant also serve until 12 - which is great if your not an early riser. The hotel is just off time square and this being our first trip to NYC was the perfect location - would definitely book again!! Free Internet access also handy.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChantalH
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 8th floor whicch was very nice. I didn't find the room small. I found it very original. The crew was very friendly and helpfull to us. There was no diversity in breakfast and it was crowded sometimes but it didn't bother us. The location is very good if you would like to stay near Times Square. The price is also very comfortable. We would go back to the this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancoLFC
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just spent a week at the Grace, & couldn't really fault it. The staff are incredibly helpful, & the location is 2 minutes from Time Square. The rooms are small, but very chic. The beds are ridiculously comfortable, & the rainfall shower is fantastic. Some toiletries are provided. Our room had a fridge, iron & board. LCD tv had over 50 channels, including HBO. Loads of room under the bed to store large suitcases which is important as there is only room for about 10 hangers. The pool was lovely, & the steam / sauna is great after a full day shopping or sightseeing. Breakfast was plentiful - cereals, 2 types of cold cut meats, cheeses, boiled eggs, toast, bagels, croissants, donuts etc, & the coffee machine offers everything - even decaf espresso?!? We got take out a couple of times & ate in the kitchen / bar area no worries. However, this would not be possible on party nights (Saturday & especially Sunday) when the hotel bar just goes nuts. Locals pay $35 entrance fee for the pool parties, guests go in free. Be warned, it is bloody loud. We knew to ask for a high up room because of this - anything above 5th floor should be fine, or you will be kept awake. The only problem we had was accessing the wi-fi, & the staff gave us comps to use the foyer internet. Like I said, they are great. There are Irish pubs next door showing all the sports you want, including live Premiership football, & the Cranberry cafe serves unbelievable NY cheesecake. We totally recommend this hotel. Yes, it's expensive, but that's New York. If you want to treat yourself, book the Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Did not Disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Lightsleeper999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for a week and booked as a result of the good reviews on this site. I was not disappointed. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable it made us look forward to getting back to it every day. The Breakfast had a wide selection and set us up perfectly for a day sightseeing and shopping in New York. The fact it was available until 12 also made it very easy to avoid the morning rush and we had no problem finding a seat to eat at. Location wise it is great Just off Time Square and close to subway stations and many of the major sights. (It gets a bit tiresome walking back to the hotel every night through Times Square though) The staff are very friendly and extremely polite. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will come back!”
Reviews.Author: claalk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great rooms. Came with friends and will come back with friends, spouse or family again. One of the few hotels we found that had more than one bed in a room. Since we were traveling as friends we all wanted our own bed. 5 of us had 2 rooms, one with 2 twin beds and one with 1 king and 1 twin loft. Good layout, never felt crowded. Lots of mirror space for ladies getting ready. Nights were quiet. Never heard neighbors, hallway noise, or outside noise. And did I say it's 1/2 a block from Times Square? It's a very central location. Even if you want to stay away from Times Square it's such a central location, it's easy to get anywhere. We used the subway to get around, walked a lot, and took a few cabs. The Deli 2 doors to the east is great for good, inexpensive meals. They have grocery items, deli, and hot and cold items. We ate at least 1 meal a day there, or brought it back to our room. Our reservations included a free breakfast at the hotel. It was a great variety of cereal, yogurt, breads, fruit, coffee, juice. We didn't use the pool (a pool in NYC?) but it looked cute. I recommend to any traveler. Single, couple, friends, families. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cstalley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the week of 10/15-10/22 at the grace. The hotel and staff exceeded our expectations. I doubt you will find a better deal the room rate was very reasonable (for Manhattan). I highly recommend the Grace.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel comes highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vikki042
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights in Room Mate Grace in NY and I totally loved it. 8 of us shared two bunk rooms and we thought they were cool and funky and the beds were really comfortable. Breakfast was really good and I thought that the hotel was excellent value for money. Location is amazing - the Perfect Pint pub is literally next door and the staff there are really friendly. Hotel is like two minutes from Times Square - I hadn't realised just how near it was and you should have seen all our faces when we walked along the street, turned the corner and there was Times Square all lit up. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DeboraFigueiredo
Reviews.Content: For those used to American hotels, the Room Mate can look weird. The rooms are very small, the ceilings are low, the lights are dimm, but the breakfast is great. No bacon and eggs, thank God. Staff is helpful, but not really friendly. Anyway, we go to the hotel to sleep, and the beds are comfortable, the shower is fantastic and the location is the best: right in the heart of the theater district. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, much better than a 3 and a half star...”
Reviews.Author: Bern0la
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend for my wifes birthday weekend. We always have a good time when we go to New York as my other half does love shopping ( as do I sometimes but don't tell her that ! ) and you can really get some great stuff at low prices if you shop about. Check out Century 21 opposite Ground Zero, very busy but worth the root to find the bargains, kind of like TK Maxx but a million times better !! Got given complimentary wi-fi access for both of us so we could have mobile internet access in our rooms which was a nice touch, didn't get a room upgrade on arrival but it was friday when we checked in. Staff were very helpful and polite always. The pictures of the website make it look quite trendy which it is and didn't realise that the location was actually a street that we had stayed on before which was The Muse hotel but Room Mate Grace was much much nicer and cheaper in price. We had a petite room which was smallish but most hotels in New York do have small rooms, had everything you needed, nice bathroom, great wet room shower but the bed was soooo comfy, we had a great nights sleep every night. Also very clean. Literally 200 yards away from Times Square, the hotel has a pool which we had never experienced before staying in New York ( which we used ) and sauna and steam room which were great also. Previously on trips to New York we would eat out for breakfast at roughly $40 a time which adds up so on the first day we tried the breakfast that was included in our stay and it was really nice so we ate the breakfast everyday which meant we had more dollars to spend elsewhere. Another positive is that the Hotel was a street away from our favourite deli in New York called Times Deli ( 45th Street ) which does the most amazing burgers and sandwiches going. Hopefully when we go to New York again we will look to book this hotel first and I hope the price does not shoot up as we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmsHarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 2nd to 7th Oct and did so based on reviews from trip advisor and we weren't dissapointed. We booked a petite room but it was still a good size for 2 people-after all it's really only somewhere to put your head down. Anyway the room was fresh and clean, nice modern shower and wash area and the bed large and comfy. I prefered this hotel to one of the large well known hotels I have stayed in on a previous visit. The staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast-continental-was good, always able to get a seat-it got quieter after 9 I would say. The location was excellent, just off times square yet quite enough to get a good nights sleep. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaJoe
Reviews.Content: Great location. easy check in and check out. Breakfast was excellent each morning. Friendly staff. Clean room. Not a single issue over 3 days. It was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad the rates aren't as cheap as the decor”
Reviews.Author: Lewesbeachfan
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Room Mate Grace and I doubt I will stay again. The room I had was an upgrade which would make wonder what kind of room I would have been given. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large, those were the best features. The remote control didn't work, neither did the high speed internet. Some lightbulbs were just exposed, not the classiest look and the furnishings were very cheap in design. It was also a challenge to open and close the curtains, you have to climb up on the bed to do this, also to turn on one of the lights. The room and the hallway were poorly lit. The decor in my room and the hall were not my taste, like something out of a 70's mod themed movie. That alone would not bother me except for the other issues. Also, the bathroom lighting was so poor it was hard to apply make-up even with the cheaply designed make-up mirror. On a positive note the staff was friendly and helpful, the pool is a fun place and the complimentary breakfast was good. It was overall a clean hotel ,but kind of dismal and the "mood lighting" throughout the hotel made it seem like evening all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brewerguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 5-9, 2010. The hotel is very small, but very clean. The smimming pool seemed like a waste. We saw only one person using it the whole stay. Maybe they should have not built the pool and instead made a larger lobby and eating area. The room was almost miniscule, but again, VERY clean...no bed bugs :)!! The linens and towels were probably the finest we've had in a hotel anywhere. Large tiled shower with rain shower head. Toilet in separate little room. Not much closet space, but we didn't need much for a 4-day stay. The location was fantastic. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see, including the two shows we booked at the Times Square Info Center. There were even two theaters on our same block. The free breakfast seemed OK, but the serving area is very cramped early in the morning with everyone crowding in to eat. A vacant table can be hard to find. We ended up eating b-fast at Starbucks across the street. The hotel staff were all very friendly. It was no problem, but I think we were the only Americans there, plus being in our 60s, the oldest people there, but it was all fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jambos77
Reviews.Content: Very well located with comfy bed. Staff very friendly and the breakfast was very good. Would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bed !”
Reviews.Author: Vennyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on an anniversary trip to NY. On arrival at the Hotel we were allocated a room with 2 bunk beds also no breakfast included ! They were overbooked and had no other room but could move us the following day. Not a massive problem we were tired and the beds were still a good size and very - very comfortable. Next day we went to the Cranberry Cafe next door - very impressive to watch them in action very fast and the food was good. We bought an New York Pass off ebay and really did the sights over a 3 day period - the pass worked well and was not only a good money saver but also motivated you to go and do stuff - did the World Yacht Cruise on a night - not cheap but using the pass got 2 free bottles of Champagne ! Our double room that we were moved to was equally as good, the bed was brilliant, I have stayed at plenty of Hotels and this was the most comfortable - maybe too soft for some people. All in all great location - turn one way and you were 50 metres from Planet Hollywood on Times Square. Turn the other and completely different, much quieter but still by the NBC studios, Rockerfeller Centre. Would recommend going to Fulton Street near Wall Street - really nice area and they have one of the Ticket booths for half price show tickets - the one in Times Square had massive lines of people waiting hours for tickets, the one at Fulton Street was much much quieter

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!!!”
Reviews.Author: macar0ni
Reviews.Content: Really trendy hotel, I was travelling with myself and 2 other girlfriends. The room was a perfect size of 4 bunks. Well decorated. The hotel had a great vibe and even threw a pool party when we were there. I have to say the breakfast was the best part of my day. A very generous buffet was included with our room. Just what we needed to head out into the snow for a day's shopping. Location is also great, a step away from times square. Right in the action!! I recommend this to all my friends holidaying in new york. Oh and the cleaning lady was super, tidying up all our shopping mess!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location for the price”
Reviews.Author: natalie8543
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a bargain rate on this hotel as we booked 6 months ahead, and for less than $200 a night the location was amazing! Times Square is probably less than a minute's walk so you feel totally central, which was great for a first-time visitor like me. After waiting for this trip for what seemed like forever, I was a little disappointed when we first arrived. Our flight was delayed by 7 hours, so after the long wait and even longer transatlantic flight, we checked in at 2am to find we'd been given the last room in the place, with 4 single bunk beds. It was nice and all, but not what we'd booked! We were moved the next day to a Petite Room without having to make too much of a fuss. The size was fine, so long as we pushed the suitcase under the bed, which was very comfy, and the shower was great. The air conditioner was pretty noisy, and the phone didn't work but apart from that the room was good. The mini fridge was useful for beers and snacks and we only ate the free breakfast once, but we would have gone back had we not discovered the $3 french toast at the Cranberry cafe next door! The free wifi was also very handy, although it took a call to tech support to set it up. The service wasn't as good as some of the larger hotels I've stayed in; we had to wait a while to have our bags retrieved from storage on the last day and were told to walk over to the Marriott to get a taxi to the airport, but I'd stay there again, especially because I never got to try out the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect but great hotel for NYC stay”
Reviews.Author: proceed_to_departure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for nine nights after getting a price that I can't seem to find again anywhere. On arrival, we were given a room which, when we got into, had a de-humidifier which had its extractor pipe through a hole in the window. This meant we couldn't close the window and noise was coming in from the air conditioning hub out the back. Thankfully, the reception staff were happy to move us to a higher floor which faced onto the street and had a window which closed (!). After that, our room was perfect. The rooms in the Grace are quite tight but we had a good deal of space. Strange sliding door for the shower and the toilet which meant if both of you were making use of the facilities, one of you were exposed to the room. The room was very modern with an iPod dock (which doesn't charge an iPhone, in case you are counting on it), plasma TV with plenty channels, safe, fridge and radio. The beds are really comfy and a good size. There was also an ice machine on our floor. Now onto breakfast. The selection is great, with bagels, toast, coffee... all the usual suspects. But the breakfast room is tiny. It is a small balcony which overlooks the swimming pool and has about 7/8 tables at a squeeze. We came down most mornings and couldn't get somewhere to sit. The alternative was to sit down around the dimly lit pool, which wasn't too pleasant we thought. It didn't seem to put others off though. The location is brilliant. The hotel is described on here as being minutes from Times Square. It's not. It's about 20-30 seconds walk to the right. If you tire of the hustle and bustle of it, turn left and you're about five minutes walk from Bryant Park and a minute from 5th Avenue. Subway stations are nearby on either side, about five minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great room design and beds, would be even better if not so pricy!”
Reviews.Author: TamR_78
Reviews.Content: Love the bed and pillows. Could have stayed in them all day, and for the price it probably would have been recommended. Rooms are small but design is very good. This would be only real downfall, for price would have wanted a bit more room and perhaps some added touches to the room i.e. bottled water, samples of products or vouchers for discounts. Fill up on breakfast/lunch.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in Room Mate Grace for 3 or 4...”
Reviews.Author: kieran456
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room Mate Grace for 3 or 4 nights, to begin our stay in New York. On arrival, the receptionists were very friendly and helpful and supplied us with maps for our stay. The facilities of the hotel were perfect, including the pool which was colourfully lit, giving the hotel a young, quirky feel. If you do use the pool, we would recommend taking your own towels from the room, because although it says not to, towels never seem to be stocked poolside. The location of the hotel was brilliant, located literally a couple of minutes from Times Square. A great stay! Would recommend to anyone looking for a relaxed city break.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: joyeria10
Reviews.Content: very good location close to time square and if you want go out and around new york city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ColleenAnger
Reviews.Content: I whole-heartedly recommend staying at the Room Mate Grace. The hotel is very conveniently located near to Time Square and has everything you would want from a very good, reasonably-priced hotel (apart from room service, that is)! The rooms are very well equipped - the beds are very comfy; there is an iPod docking station in each room as well as a dvd player; the a/c worked brilliantly (essential in the NY summer!) and the shower was great too - although there were no towel rails in our bathroom, which made it difficult to hang up our wet towels after showering, but this is really the only (small) negative I have to report about our stay. The breakfasts also exceeded expectations (awesome coffee, in particular) and were included in the daily rate!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a mess! DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: rickie250
Reviews.Content: If you plan on staying at this hotel, be warned! They will possibly not have a room for you and will make your life a living hell by sending you 20 blocks to a disgusting hotel that will honor the rate that you were to pay them. Then they will charge your credit card and credit it a number times, ultimately charing you. Your credit card bill will look insane but you won't mind that because you will be walking through the streets of NYC trying to find a room and eventually you will land in an acceptable hotel for the double amount but will not be reimbursed for the difference. In addition, it seems the staff turnover is huge. The person you booked the hotel with that sent you the resrvation just 3 weeks prior will no longer be there. So you will be unable to get any help with your credit card problems and your one night stay, that never happened, will turn into weeks of torment!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel - a real gem, and cute”
Reviews.Author: Chinoy628
Reviews.Content: My sister, her little toddler, and I stayed at Room Mate Grace in May 2010. We loved the hotel. It is trendy, cute, and a great hotel if you are more than 2 people and require a larger bed and a small bed, the layout of the room was very good for a toddler. The staff was very helpful when I had to deal with a personal problem that required printing out an email.- and they did it without charging me at all. Wi-fi is complementary which is very important to me. The location is excellent, and on a quiet street very close to Time Square. We had no problems whatsoever and enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much. A real gem of a place in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, international vibe, comfy rooms, and terrific service.”
Reviews.Author: SATXKen
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay (at least) at this hotel back to when it was Q. The desk upgraded our room to a superior one free of charge when I asked for a higher floor. This gave us a room on the 11th floor. As a result, we finally got to experience the shower with the window (frosted halfway up) that I had read about before. It was a great room with views up 45th street to Times Square. We love this hotel for its international vibe. Almost all people at breakfast were speaking some foreign language. Speaking of breakfast, we always enjoy it. And the location of the hotel is so convenient to Broadway, Times Square, metro stops, etc. Each night when we returned to the hotel from dinner and/or a show, the pool and bar were packed and hopping. We did not join in, but there certainly was a lively scene. Once on the elevator, and to our room, we could not hear it. That is why I wanted a higher floor to begin with. Free Wi-fi was very nice and easy. Loida at the front desk was a joy to work with. Beds are VERY comfortable. I'm sure we will stay there the next time we go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn Not a 'grace'ful ending”
Reviews.Author: ASQCQM
Reviews.Content: For my first business trip to NYC, I booked this hotel because of good reviews and it's proximity to Times Square where I had a business meeting. Upon arriving, I was told that there was a problem in the hotel and they were very sorry (very polite front desk staff), but I could not stay there. They had booked me in another hotel, and the cost would be covered by them. I was polite, expressed my dissapointment, and accepted the $40 that they gave me for cab fare to get me to the new hotel and back to Times Square. They sent me to the Nu Hotel in Brooklyn ($25 cab fare ($30 w/ tip)), and I checked in to find out that they were full, but I did have a room (although without AC.) The rate at this hotel was abour $30 less than RM Grace rate which I booked through a travel agent. We'll see how I can explain this one to finance when filling out my reimbursemenet report!

Reviews.Title: “smaller, but great boutique hotel in a...”
Reviews.Author: smakkar06
Reviews.Content: smaller, but great boutique hotel in a great location- right around the corner from Times Square & the Theater District. We had a standard room which while compact, like other NYC rooms, was still well laid out and the bed was very comfortable. Indoor pool with swim-up bar was nice and unique. Better than average continental breakfast included with your stay in nice lounge area. Staff was nice & helpful. We took a red-eye and thankfully, our room was ready @ 10am and they let us right in. Overall, an excellent, updated, modern boutique hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Swim with drink in hand, and at the end of the night, a king size bed awaits”
Reviews.Author: Marisa500
Reviews.Content: Love the Room Mate Grace. I book a room every year for my birthday weekend. And I spend the day swimming in the indoor pool, drink in hand, listening to tunes spun by the poolside DJ. And when I want another, I just swim up to the poolside bar. One of my favorite things about this hotel is the giant king size platform beds. I sleep like a baby every time I stay! I wish the continental breakfast was still free, but I think they changed to a buffet breakfast for $10pp, which is still a deal for New York. Also, I noticed the room rates have gone up over the years. It is a fabulous place to stay especially if you take advantage of the pool and sauna. And its right in midtown -- perfect for the NY first timer or anyone who wants to splash in a pool while in the middle of the city -- without the uppitiness often associated with the city's midtown lounges or downtown pools. Its always a very fun and chill environment.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT ROOM MATE GRACE”
Reviews.Author: Michael255060
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Room Mate Grace was far from graceful. Upon check in, I was given a room that did not have a working air conditioner. I asked reception if there was another room available as it was far too hot to sleep in the room without adequate cooling but was told there were no more rooms available for the duration of my stay. An engineer was sent up to take a look at the broken air conditioner and he told us that we would have to make do with an air cooling unit that was plugged into the side of a window that was then covered in plastic. Not only was the air cooling unit far too loud to have turned on while sleeping, when it was turned on, it produced very little cool air at all. I asked again on our second night for another room and was again told that there were no other rooms available so we were forced to sweat out 5 nights in 80+ degree heat. Upon checking out, I raised my concerns with the receptionist who listened attentively then went to fetch the duty manager so I could pass my comments onto a person in a position to take some action or offer an apology. After waiting 15 minutes for the duty manager to come to reception, I was told that she â€œwas too busy to come and talk to me.â€� Not only is this unprofessional, it is rude and disrespectful. Also, there was no door to the shower! There was a shower curtain but absolutely no privacy when my travelling companion or I needed to take a shower. The bathroom in our room was also less than perfect with plastic on the windows. Overall, the room had an unfinished quality about it, exposed pipes were visible on the ceiling too. The continental breakfast wasnâ€™t too crash hot either. The dinning area is opposite the pool which meant that breakfast had to be endured while breathing in pool chemicals and chlorine. In summary, there was a disappointing level of customer service from management and the very hot new york days were not at all helped by the very hot Room Mate Grace hotel room at night. Iâ€™ve had better stays at other hotels that were nowhere near as expensive as this.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, great location, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Cazza008
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters more for the younger '20 something' traveller, but we stayed with a seven year old who loved the loft bed above our king size bed. Breakfast included was basic: cereals, toast, hard boiled eggs and ham, bagels, fruit, etc with alternates of mini muffins and mini donuts. Considering this was included in the tarriff, it was good value. The pool wasn't as user friendly as we would have liked, each night loud music and 'happy hours', so not conducive to relaxation. Obviously catering to the younger crowd. Drinks at the bar very expensive. Around $10 US a mixed drink. The free wi-fi really sucked, most times couldn't get a connection in our room, and when we did it only lasted for about 10 minutes. Not good for someone on business. Best connection found at the breakfast lounge. Staff for the most part were helpful and friendly. The location was fantastic, only 100 metres from the heart of times square. The room was cleverly designed to maximize space, and the bathroom was huge! Some of the fixtures needed repair, ladder to loft bed wobbly, small mirror in bathroom falling out of the wall, some issues with the lift not working for a few days. The king size bed was super comfy!!! I would stay at this hotel again if travelling to NYC. Highly recommend it for tourists who want to be in the middle of everything with easy access to all the sites, without the high end tourist price. Subway just around the corner too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: NadiaMic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Times Square. Only issue we had is that the bathroom has no curtains on the windows. Breakfast was a bit limited so got a bit boring after 6 days. Otherwise hotel was good and worth going.

Reviews.Title: “If service isn't important to you, it is a great location.”
Reviews.Author: RTBINC
Reviews.Content: Great location and cool idea with pool yet service was not good. Bar closed early and steam/sauna off early despite 24 hour claim. No one ever greeted us as we entered hotel. Pool is open to the public for a fee so don't expect an intimate experience. Rooms are small and dimly lit. Breakfast was okay yet very small room so seating is limited. Fitness center includes 2 exercise bikes and a small group of weights. Would recommend for location only. Geared toward European tourist who value price over service and ammenities. Would HIGHLY recommend The Perfect Pint Pub next store over the hotel pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is not what it used to be, but still my first choice in NYC”
Reviews.Author: wangdesign
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Room Mate Grace since it was the Hotel QT and have had a wonderful experience each time. The rooms are small but comfortable--triple pane windows, exceptionally comfortable mattress and pillows, friendly and helpful staff. Our only disappointment this year was the breakfast (which is actually one reason why we came back!) Gone were the fresh raspberries and blueberries and the different kinds of yogurts (including plain!) Even the juice was downgraded to a cheaper, sugary brand. This may be a result of the breakfast hours being extended to noon instead, but we sorely missed the quality of the food we had before. It was definitely a point of differentiation. Please bring it back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property---if you remove all the people there”
Reviews.Author: lollipops
Reviews.Content: The Room was spacious, two of us stayed in a triple room that had an overhead bunkbed. I had stayed at this hotel when it used to be under different management and was called Hotel QT about 5 years ago. I guess I've aged, and the clientele hasn't. They still throw pool parties, which I personally think put a damper on things in the hotel. I couldn't help but roll my eyes a little every time i passed the pool (elevators right in front of the pool bar). The service itself was average for being a hotel in New York, but below average for the price we were paying. It took them a day to fix the phone and light bulb in our room. And checking in took forever. Like f o r e v e r. Maid service came knocking on our door at 8.30am. EIGHT THIRTY. Who does that? When we didn't answer, they opened up saw us sleeping and said they'd come back later. Well, yeah, it's only 8am. Maid service came back again later and then asked if we wanted our room clean... I mean all this before 10am. I found that a bit too much. However, it only happened our first morning there (We stayed a total of 3 nights). The walls are THIN. The room next door was loud and we could hear them in the hallway and outside their door. There was a young man behind the front desk that was very nonchalant in answering questions we had. We were worried about the yellow cabs not being able to store all our luggage (We had 4 big suitcases), he didn't even bother to offer us different car services ie. town cars, suvs. He just said "don't worry about it, it'll fit". Well, 1. It didn't fit. 2. Do your job and give me my options. It's almost sad, the property is great, the rooms are fun and funky. But man, the people just ruin it. And the wifi is like... a huge joke. Thank goodness it was free. That's probably why it wasn't working half the time. I'd love to give it another chance, because I do have fond memories of it, but I have a sneaky suspicion that it's just targeted to a much younger demographic (I'm not even 30 yet!) and the service has just gone down hill. We stayed at the Muse earlier part of our trip, and I think I'll be sticking with that from now on.

Reviews.Title: “economical hotel near Time Square, though not cheap for any other areas of the US..”
Reviews.Author: Seo_Seoul
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is proximity to Time square for relatively low price. I & my friends had very good time there, and it was so convinient to go out and get in. But I wish TV in my room to get fixed, because a thick vertical black line on screen bothered us during watching TV.

Reviews.Title: “Grace Hotel in Manhattan - stay here if you can its fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jiburns
