Reviews.Content: We stayed in Grace for 8 days and it was fantastic - we had a room on the 15th floor - perfect - high enough up to miss the noise of being in the heart of the city.The hotel is positioned on 45th Street between 6th and 7th Avenuses - perfect for broadway and all of the other Manhattan attractions.Hotel itself was great small swimming pool with a swim up bar - perfect place to relax tired feet and legs, good music and a little gym - ideal. The breakfast room on our first morning seemed a little daunting - self service - but once we found our way around the various stations, the standard was terrific. Lots of chatter etc a great way to meet and make new friends. We loved it and if this is the standard of Room Mate hotels we will certainly use them again on our travels.

Reviews.Title: “this room was the true definition of hot!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy2778
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an amazing location (right in time square), a really trendy bar/pool area and awesome free breakfast, BUT our room was extremely hot! We complained to the staff daily and they stated it was fixed but it was never any cooler than about 80 degrees in the room. The maintenance guy said he would bring us a portable a/c unit after his fourth visit to our room and never returned. i called the front desk and they said there were no fans available (they were all being used). i would have said this was one amazing hotel if we had just been able to sleep comfortably..... Suchs to sweat all night on your vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: hoshikuma
Reviews.Content: A recent trip to NYC reminded me that I never got around to reviewing Room mate Grace. I tried to get a room here again, but the hotel was booked. I really wish I had been successful. Room mate Grace is a great value in a convenient location. The rooms are spacious and a free breakfast is included. I will definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ealvesjr
Reviews.Content: Incredible location in Times Square, with pool and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: J_and_DLondon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Grace in New York. As with the other Room Mate hotels, it has real character and is well located. Breakfast (buffet style) was good, and our room was very modern and super-clean. The pool was perhaps a little bit of a let-down - we walked past several times when it was very busy and noisy (the hotel advertises pool parties open to the public) which put us off using it. But you don't go to NYC to sit in the pool, so it was no bother.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: boulba
Reviews.Content: Quiet and clean. Good breakfast Room very dark because any view from the room

Reviews.Title: “Aesome little gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vsan09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and all the action of NYC. I loved the room and the hotel staff was very professional. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but would not rave about it, especially when a volcano explodes”
Reviews.Author: funnybones123
Reviews.Content: Grace Hotel was comfortable enough and convenient to the sights of Manhatten. The highlight would definately have been the included breakfast. The down side was during the "Icelandic volcanic ash" travel disaster I had enquired about availability about staying extra nights. When it came down to it, despite confirming that there were rooms available the day before for us to stay for longer, we were kicked out at the eleventh hour and were not even allowed to make one phone call to make alternative arrangments because it was "check out time" and new guests were expected in "4 hours". There was no apology for the mis-information about availability. Not exactly enticing service for a repeat visit..............I would not rate this hotel for its service, It has an upmarket "youth hostel-like feel" and the staff were pretty unfriendly and unwelcoming. Don't be fooled by the "trendy" appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel (and even better breakfast)!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMJ99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good spot for sightseeing. Plenty of subway stations, shops and attractions around. We really liked the room, good comfortable bed (pillows could be better though), nice clean bathroom, handy fridge and most importantly a safe so you don't have to carry all those important documents and valuables around with you. Breakfast was so much more than what we were expecting...heaps of variety and constantly being stocked up. There was even a coffee machine that makes lattes etc. We've only been back a week but i already miss the Grace breakfasts! The free internet was excellent..nice and fast. Overall a great hotel...a little pricey but good for the location , plus you don't have to buy breakfast each day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will always try to stay here when in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BurlingtonJamie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, quiet (good soundproofing between rooms), good amenities, great location. Free breakfast was very good. Pubs and deli very close by, and just down the street from Times Square and Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, well-designed spaces and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jsteg
Reviews.Content: We purposely chose the smallest room and were impressed with the design thoughtfulness and features. Very clever and fun. Great front desk, great European style breakfast (and a bustling breakfast room with many foreign travelers) and the pool is a kick. This is not a "luxury" experience (nor were we looking for that) but very fun. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for multiple travlers”
Reviews.Author: pghtraveler26
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother, her German exchange student and I just returned from a trip to New York. We stayed at Room Mate Grace hotel. Overall it was a good experience. We had a room that had 4 twin size beds set up as bunk beds. It was perfect for our situation and ended up saving us a lot of money since we only needed one room. The free breakfast is surprisingly good and the location is perfect for showing people New York. We only had to walk a few blocks to the play we had tickets to. My husband and I stayed at this hotel in 2005 when it was still called the QT. Both times we had good experiences. My only complaints are that the front desk staff are a bit slow and you end up waiting a long time to get checked in and out. Also, for a room that is supposed to house 4 individual travelers I would expect more than just a frosted shower curtain (no door, opens directly to room) for privacy when showering.

Reviews.Title: “I lost stuff at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: thotranh
Reviews.Content: My stay at Room Mate Grace by March 31st, 2010 was a pleasant stay. Like most of people, we felt that the location was perfect. I also like the complimentary breakfast . However, on the last day, I lost my GPS right in the room (805) after we came back to the room. I knew exactly where I put my GPS and it was gone . I checked with the lost and found. I even came back after I checked out of the hotel. The people who stayed in 805 after me were nice enough to let the hotel people to do one last check of the room to find my GPS. No luck ! Could it be the janitor, I couldn't even tell . However, I am 100% sure that I lost my GPS at the hotel , where I put inside the room. So be careful ! It was part of my fault that I did not put it in a safe, but , it's only a GPS !

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Nini09
Reviews.Content: Great place with a very good breakfast. Small nice rooms. The cleaning of the room could be better. Great service for informations and tours!

Reviews.Title: “My 13-year-old daughter and I absolutely adored this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aftkel
Reviews.Content: Clean, well-cared for property, excellent breakfast each day included in the cost of the hotel, located near Broadway and Times Square, extremely knowledgeable and helpful staff. They had an interesting indoor pool and steam room, though we did not use it. Our room was on 14th floor--room 1404. It had a great shower, nice control of temperature in the room itself, very comfortable and quiet room, great bed with nice linens and a comforter, small refrigerator in the room. Our TV worked very well. Clientele was interesting--a mix of Americans and Europeans--all of them very nice. I'm not sure what more one could want in a hotel. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fun hotel for the young or the young-at-heart”
Reviews.Author: lampreave
Reviews.Content: The interior design is terrific! The pool, with bar, is fun and gets packed in the evenings. The rooms are comfortable enough, though very basic and no-frills. The breakfast was surprisingly excellent (included in the price for a room), and I would return to this hotel just for this reason. You can't beat the location, and I could definitely see making this my regular hotel for when I travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A place even New Yorkers can love”
Reviews.Author: viharNyc
Reviews.Content: We spent a single night here to celebrate a birthday since we were too busy for a real getaway. Well, this was a great facsimile. Since I have never been a tourist in NYC (we live here) I had never stayed in a hotel let alone in Times Square, which I avoid like the plague. But, staying at Room Mate was like a real vacation. The location is excellent and surpisingly quiet. A night the room is dark and silent. Great sexy design-- platform bed, mirrors, minimal but effective. Large room for Times Square. Immaculately clean. The indoor pool/bar scene is amazing. A pool in NYC is a rarity even for the posh. Worth the price. Friendly staff. Not pretentious--unlike a lot of lower Manhattan hotels of similar caliber... And somehow the patrons gave the place an even cooler vibe. No "ugly Americans" or "Eurosnobs" here. Also, and this is a plus for me, no kids! If you like Dwell mag and the lifestyle it peddles, you'll like this place. I have already recommended it to fellow NYCers looking for a sexy weekend in a boutique atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: krpurvis
Reviews.Content: I search Trip Adviser for hotels for our NY trip. Hotel Room Mate Grace was the highest ranked in our price point and it certainly did not disappoint! The rooms was a good size, super funky and modern and they were super clean and comfortable. The staff was always helpful and always present (even when we came in super late. I always felt safe.) Not to mention the free breakfast in the morning! That's rare in NYC! One block away is Times Square so it's a wonderful location! So close to restaurants, theaters and subways. I never had an issue getting a taxi either. This is my 3rd trip to NY and 3rd hotel. This by FAR is the best as far as value and location. I've found my NY Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well located and fancy”
Reviews.Author: Chilaris
Reviews.Content: Very close to the center of the nightlife: Times Square. The Hotel itself is a cocktail bar during the night and can be a bit inconvenient for people looking for a quite staying, but once in the room you cannot hear anything but the normal city sound... I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: freelobe
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel-which is hard to find, cozy rooms right at the Times Square. Staff was good and the breakfast was really nice. We stayed at the 11th floor so we couldn;t hear any noise at all not only from the street outside but also from the parties inside the hotel. One small problem though. We arrived late and the reception at the check in could be more polite since she told us that we were upgraded to a better room with no extra charge but she gave us a room which we found -at our surprise- that was locked from the inside and were other people in it! She apologised , gave us another room but that was it. Not much of a good first impression. All other people in the staff was very polite and helpful though. All and all a great choice for a hotel in the center of Manhattan, considering the other options and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - be sure to confirm smoking or non”
Reviews.Author: Suite2100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near times sq and has: fun design/decor, free breakfast and wifi and charges a very competitive rate. However, I checked in late (9pm) and they gave me a smoking room (desk clerk said nothing). It was late and while not happy I just "lived with it" for one night - in the morning they told me all the non-smoking rooms were already given out that day. So non-smoking is not assured - just a warning. I know a lot of hotels are totally non-smoking now so folks do not even think this could be an issue in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, tip top room, awesome location. Definetly go back.”
Reviews.Author: fletchdirect
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here - everything about this hotel was just very very good. It was a little hot inside the public areas, but overall - we had a great time. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in NY City!”
Reviews.Author: dieterdulst
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute we stayed in the hotel: in the morning the wonderful breakfast, at noon the excellent service and guidelines of the staff, in the afternoon the swimmingpool, sauna and steamtub and in the evening the marvellous bed... It was awesome! Dieter and Annelien Dulst from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Good, but slightly expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Ribblerouser
Reviews.Content: One thing's for certain, the management employed a good photographer! The photos on the website make the hotel look very chic, but the reality is rather more prosaic. First the good points. It's a very good location, and the staff are pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean and fairly well insulated from the noise of the city, so you can get a good night's sleep. They serve breakfast till late (11am weekdays, noon weekends) so if you like a lie-in after a strenuous night on the town that's good (though it's only a cold buffet, no hot breakfasts as far as I could see). The crticisms aren't serious, more in the nature of mild disappointment. For example, one factor that influenced me to book was the swimming pool - except it isn't!. It looks great on the pix, but in fact it's pretty small and a uniform depth of 3' 9", which is really more like a large paddling pool. Don't get me wrong, it's pleasant enough to splash around in but a proper swimming pool it is not. There's also nowhere to get changed to swim, so you either have to change in your room and travel up and down the elevator in your swimwear, or use the loo near the bar and hope nobody pinches your clothes while you're swimming. The pool is also very much overlooked. The fact that it's next to the bar may be good if you want a drink, but it also means that you are subject to the scrutiny of New York's finest, and in such an image-conscious city you may feel that you're not quite as perfectly-honed as they would want - you'ill certainly be breathing in when you exit the pool, that's for sure! Another slightly annoying aspect is that the room lighting is quite dim, even on max. Whoever took the website pix certainly used extra lighting. The room facilities are quite basic - there's a fridge, but no minibar (though as I never use them anyway this didn't bother me). And there's no plug for the washbasin, though if you put the water glass over the plughole and fill it with water it works quite well. The shampoo etc comes in little square, rigid containers that seem to be unique to Grace. This is a PITA, as you can't squeeze it out, you have to smack its bottom till it reluctantly emerges! And I couldn't get the wi-fi to work, though this may be because I was trying to use it with an iPhone. I could get connected to the service provider (Roomlinx?) but although it said `You are connected to the internet" as soon as I tried to access the internet it cut off. As I said, this could be just an issue with an iPhone, but the help number on the Roomlinx link was out of service, and the front desk staff didn't have clue. In any event, why does it have to be so complicated? Everywhere else just has a straightforward wi-fi zone, so why not here? I ended up having to pay to use the internet access in the lobby, which entirely defeats the purpose. NOT impressed with this aspect of the deal. And finally the price. As usual with US hotels, the headline rate is just the start, and after all the taxes etc were added the bill came out at just over $250 a night. Whilst this may not of itself be very expensive for the location I felt it was quite a lot for a pleasant, but not fantastic hotel. But perhaps that's just because I'm a Brit and the pound is weak against the mighty dollar!

Reviews.Title: “different type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: sem2671
Reviews.Content: I am from NH (New England area) Hotel was different fromn what I am use to. However I never felt out of place. Was treated better at hotel Grace than at a 5 star hotel I stayed at before (2yrs ago). Staf was helpful knowlegeable of area. Breakfast was wonderful so many choices and ideas. Swim up bar was "great" Pricey but was worth it. Would not recommend families with kids.. Geared to younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SVNLK
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, cozy and comfortable property in a great location in Midtown/Theatre District. Rooms are very small, but efficient and clean - design means something here. Excellent breakfast - both for food and space. Amenities and staff are wonderful. We've stayed several times and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fab and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: YubYub
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob and was worried about staying here -- but I loved every aspect of Room Mate Grace. The rooms are small, but super cool, comfy,quiet and efficient. The breakfast was yummy with a nice selection of foods. Coffee and tea are available all day and evening. I'll be staying here again next time I have business in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “drizlling shower”
Reviews.Author: westendryu
Reviews.Content: My staying was almomst good but the water pressure of the shower was very week, it was like a drizzle. I've asked to front clerks twice during my stay but it's not been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Book it!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I spent weeks deciding which hotel to choose for my bf's surprise 21st Birthday trip. I eventually chose Grace and it was well beyond my expectations. Champagne on arrival, clean, modern, stylish and comfortable room. Everything we needed. The hotel gym, sauna, steam room and pool made the stay, especially as there is a bar separating the pool and the lounge so it becomes one big party area! Had a few great nights of entertainment, including an 80's night and a new band playing. Jeff the barman is a star and one of NYC's top 10 barmen! Just do it, book it, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Euro hotel with great location, though lacking amenities other than free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: kikigin
Reviews.Content: If you say you have a bar that's open until 2am, don't close it at midnight because no one is there. Came from a great bar scene by MSG, just to find my own hotel DEAD. Not as happening as it wants to be. Plus the rooms are a bit spartan. The fitness center is a joke. The internet service wasn't great, though it was free.

Reviews.Title: “A real letdown over our entire holiday”
Reviews.Author: manthufagasparks
Reviews.Content: Good- The hotel is in a great location, right off Times Square and central to everything. The included breakfast and attached bar were also quite nice and convenient. However they were the only good points of the hotel. Bad- The service we recieved was quite poor overall. It was hard to get service at the front desk, and when we did have an issue they didnt resolve it for us. The rooms were a lot smaller than they looked and not well thought out with a bit of wasted space. Not good when the rooms are cramped already. Our air conditioning did not work, so our room was freezing. We complained 3 times to the front desk over our 6 day stay, they eventually gave us a small portable heater that did nothing, even though we were advised we would be upgraded if they couldnt fix it. At the end, nothing was said or done even though we told them again we werent happy with the service. The showers are a slow drip with no pressure so we couldnt even warm up during them. Overall, it was probably the worst place we stayed in 2 months throughout America, taking into account the $30 motels we also stayed at elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a unique experience in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: waverunner48
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Grace for 2 nights and had a fantastic time...and at $460 for both nights, it was a great bargain as well. The hotel is stylish and chic, def not like your typical business hotel. The ammenities (pool, sauna, steam room, lounge) are a real treat for anyone staying here. The pool and bar are open all night, so it is pretty common to see half the people walking around in dress clothes, and the other half wearing bathing suits/bikinis. The night-time "pool party" caters to a younger crowd, and is more like mtv-spring-break-meets-new-york-city. PROS: the complimentary breakfast served until 12 noon on weekends is delicious, and best of all...FREE! Grace is located right in the middle of Times Square, so there is plenty to do without having to travel too far. My personal favorite was the sauna...very relaxing and enjoyable. CONS: the rooms are small, we booked a deluxe-sized room (the 2nd largest size) and were a little surprised to see how much space we had. The rooms are a little drafty too, so if you go in the winter, be prepared to turn the thermostat all the way up! The only other thing I wish Grace had was room service, but the breakfast made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: DotOnTheI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just awesome, I honestly have no criticism at all. Our "petite" room was much bigger than we expected and more than enough for the 3 nights we spent there! The hotel is funky, chic, boutique and boosts a very relaxed vibe! My two highlights were the pool with its swim-up bar and the delicous, healthy FREE breakfast in the moring. All of this for a very decent price, especially for New York. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and will definitely come back the next time I visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “if you like rooms smaller than a wardrobe, this is your place”
Reviews.Author: Madrid_2007
Reviews.Content: The room size is simply not acceptable, you do not even get a wardrobe, but a half meter long bar where you can hang your clothes on. The bed is only accessable from one side. It is impossibe to stay in this place. Breakfast is nice, although usually the small breakfast room is over-full and it may be hard to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “What a hip and happening place!!”
Reviews.Author: Ange069
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but that's New York. Besides that, this place is wonderful. Great location in Times Square! The rooms are very comfortable and very modern. The staff are very helpful and know New York. Breakfast is quite good, and the pool/spa and bar area is a must during the evening. It is very popular and does draw a very good and attractive crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Whangaman
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least twice a year for business and it is always very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. I love the indoor pool they have and the beds are almost as comfortable as sleeping at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable, fun pool”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Friday and Saturday night in January. Room was spacious, especially by NYC standards, and the bathroom & shower were enormous. Bed was on a slightly raised platform, plenty of storage space beneath. The room had an iPod dock, and there is free WiFi throughout the hotel. The pool (located just off lobby - photo attached) is a terrific feature, nicely heated in January, open 24 hours, with the swim-up bar open at 5pm. Free breakfast the next morning - the food is fine but the room is rather small; you may have to wait for a table. Convenient location on a side street off Times Square. I prefer this to some hotels located directly on the square, where you get swept along by the flow of the tourist crowd as soon as you step out the front door. Room Mate is a chain and I was on their mailing list after a previous stay in another city - email promotional rate of 150/night (177 w/taxes) was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkFrogie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well priced. Very modern and hip. Great hotel for youge adults. We got upgraded for free to a suite on the 16th floor. It was very nice. The elevators are very fast, the bed was extremly comfortable, but the pillows were too soft though. The room could use more lighting and a full length mirror, but besides that it was wonderful. I would deffinately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ElenaHour
Reviews.Content: Spotless and spacious (for NY standards, at least) room, superb breakfast (yes, the breakfast room is relatively small but in the 15 days we stayed there we always managed to find an empty table). The housekeeper accidentally broke my husband's perfume and she/he replaced it immediately leaving a very sweet note, while the management left us a letter apoligising for the event. On our check-out day, the hotel offered to store our luggage (a guy picked it up, had it labelled and numbered and carried it to their storing area) and a taxi was waiting for us to drive us to the airport (no extra charge for any of these). Needless to say, the location is perfect. I will definitely recommend it to all of my friends who'll visit the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “trendy boutique hotel, close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: barb87
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay but then we were upgraded to a deluxe, with complimentary drinks vouchers as well. Thank you, Grace. Breakfast content was excellent for a buffet but space was very limited and it got crowded even though the hotel was not very full and the number of tables was limited. Nice pool area, we'd recommend staying away from the bar area if you can as it was noisy - we didn't hear anything on the fifth floor. Other guests were noisy in the corridor at night and our neighbour must have been jet -lagged as his telly was on all night and the walls were not too good at soundproofing. Noisy aircon as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great. Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: PaulD_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location right next to times square. I think it would be hard to neat with price and location. Some great Irish bars right next door if you fancy a late night drink or bite to eat. The pool and especially the steam room were a great addition to relax after a hard days walking. Only downside was the bar which was expensive even for NYC. Not a problem as loads of other choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mat_wicky
Reviews.Content: great location, really nicely decorated, tasty breakfast and really comfortable bed would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “interesting place”
Reviews.Author: markcassel
Reviews.Content: first time staying here.............a saturday and sunday nite. overall, a very good experience.the front desk was very nice and professional. the room was clean. the tv was a little on the small side, and non-hd. the free breakfasts were good, not super crowded like I had read before our stay.......and the pool, was VERY intertesting. small, but a GREAT place to people watch. seems like there were more outsiders than actual hotel guest using the whole pool/bar area. a bit loud, due to a great number of people in such a small area. and I do believe the party atmosphere of this area led to my ONLY COMPLAINT of this particular stay........................A drunken 30-ish year old male, clad only in his bathing suit, awoke us at 230am monday morning by LOUDLY SCREAMING and BANGING on the room door right next to us. this went on I would say 15-20 minutes before security arrived. it turns out this guy was trying to get into a room that he thought was his, but of course it wasnt. he couldnt even stand up as he was banging on the door.............................other than this incident, I really liked the hotel. it is less than one full block from times square.............. A GREAT LOCATION !

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful, hip, hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: momof2inva_10
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter to New York for a girls weekend, and we both loved this hotel! The location was fantastic - only 1/2 block from Times Square. The room was not large, but it was clean, and the platform bed was very comfortable. A continental breakfast was included in the rate, and it was very good. I especially enjoyed the fresh raspberries and blueberries. For the money, this hotel can not be beat! I would not recommend this hotel for families with small children, but for everyone else it is a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting!”
Reviews.Author: GolferFee
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of everything. We could walk to theatre, shopping, Rockefeller Centre and the Port Authority bus terminal. Thank you for your email 3 days before we arrived to advise us of the best way to get to your hotel from the airport. Everything went so smooth.

Reviews.Title: “NYC rendevous”
Reviews.Author: seeyalater2010
Reviews.Content: Check-in went smoothly the clerk was patient and nice. I wasupgraded from the smallest of rooms to a deluxe for booking with TripAdvisor. The Guest Room was really fabulous. Being an Interior Designer, I appreciated all of the details that were addressed in the design of the the whole environment from the Lobby on up. The free breakfast is just awesome...the pool, steam room and bar offered an interesting and very different take on staying in mid-town Manhattan! It may be possible that my friend and I were the only Americans staying this weekend. I enjoyed hearing languages from all over the globe. It made me feel great knowing that I could come back time after time and get that special feeling knowing I was staying someplace rather chic.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_Alice
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Grace. The hotel is clean, modern, brilliant value - and perfectly located on the edge of Times Square. The breakfast buffet is extensive, but as mentioned by previous reviewers, does get a bit hectic! However, we avoided the crowds by grabbing a tray and taking it up to our room instead. Despite not taking a dip in the pool, we did sample a few cocktails at the bar, served by cheery and helpful bar staff. The rooms are an ample size for a city break stay - and ours was kept shiny and tidy throughout our stay by the very friendly housekeeping team. We've already recommended Grace to our friends, and would most definitely return next time we're in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff in their expression of personal biases against homosexuals.”
Reviews.Author: maggles608
Reviews.Content: Saturday January 9th was quite the experience. I knew that Hotel Grace catered to the gay community, but my boyfriend and I weren't quite prepared for the spectacle we saw in the lobby when we came back that night. However, I was not displeased or offended in any way. What was distatesful to me was the following morning, when we checked out at 1 pm. While chatting about our stay, two Hotel Grace employees surprised me a great deal. The woman behind the lobby desk and the gentleman who stowed our luggage for us (for the day) both were quite unprofessional regarding the previous evening. The two employees gossiped about the clientele from the night before in a very uncomplimentary manner. Among other comments, the female attendant told us that "half the guests complained about last night." I asked, quite genuinely, why. The male attendant snarked, "WHY? You'd have to be blind to not know what was going on last night." He then went on to express his personal disgust in the appearance of the bar guests (or in his words, the "polar bears"). Confiding one's personal views to a coworker is one thing, but bashing the bar guests in front of hotel guests was distasteful. I was unimpressed by their lack of tact and unprofessionalism. A third employee, a woman behind the desk, was also present but did not participate in the discussion. Besides the gay bashing, the hotel was adequate, but did not impress me in any way. Customer service was lacking. After we checked in, we notified the front desk about a broken light bulb, and the front desk attendant was curt in her response. Maybe I'm being unfair. At least the mattress was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, the expectation was greater than the reality.”
Reviews.Author: ruibranq
Reviews.Content: I was very curious about the hotel but I honestly do not intend to stay there again. I stayed in one of the largest rooms - not so big but ok. The view was a wall and the service was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeromeNancy
Reviews.Content: We could not dream of a better place to stay!! We had reserved a Deluxe room with King size bed. The room was still small but very comfortable and anyway we spent a lot of time in the pool area with the steam room and sauna. Great after long days' walks in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Sister Act”
Reviews.Author: CSCSwiss
Reviews.Content: - Great Mexican Restaurant: Caliente :-) - Front Desk, very helpfull finding good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “New York New York BIG City”
Reviews.Author: goodrabbit1966
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Grace (at our time QT Hotel by AndrÃ© Balazs) is a great City Hotel in NYC: prices are reasonable, location is fantastic (you walk out and you're on Times Square!!), the hotel is very dark but trendy, clean, has friendly staff, you get a decent breakfast, (breakfast room is a bit small and...don't drink that coffe !) & the small swimming pool / sauna / steam room were great during our stay. The hotel's lower level turns into a club at night, so there may be some "beats" in the reception...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect right on TIMES SQUARE doorstep,will definetly return someday”
Reviews.Author: bamboMeath
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 5 nights and it was a very enjoyable stay, room was a little small but staying at such a central hotel made up for it. The breakfast each morning was great, staff were lovely and helpfull. One minor problem was the bed pushed into the corner right beside window could be quiet chilly fin January for the person lying on that side of bed, so anyone who feels the cold easy it could be a problem, but with the room heated constantly it didnt bother me as i had to ly on that side of the bed cos my boyfriend is a bit of a pansy so he complained about the cold a little. Plenty of tv stations to watch, shower was brilliant very powerful always steaming hot water. The hotel is brilliant for the money you pay which is very reasonable, and if your Irish you be happy to know the hotel is between two Irish bars and if that doesnt interest you when you walk out the hotel door your looking at times square which is some view.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: lynne49
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for Christmas week and were very satisfied with everything. Reception staff were very welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. We were grateful for the unexpected upgrade on our room. A nice touch! I chose RMG initially for the pool but in fact didn't use it: it's too small for my usual morning swim but suits the purpose of a bar area, I suppose! We didn't brave the sauna or steam room either. I'm sure they're ok but it was pretty cold outside so we were glad to be warm and keep our clothes on when indoors. I wonder if the pool is really necessary: rarely anyone in there and perhaps a huge management expense for such little use? Everything else about RMG was excellent. I was impressed with the cleanliness: the excellent quality towels and bed linen were changed every day if you wished. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned daily. The cleaning staff were unobtrusive and very pleasant. The beds were very comfortable, if a little awkward to negotiate in the middle of the night. Whilst I would subscribe to the cosy, romantic, plush decor of a traditional home, I like a hotel room to be chic and minimal: it's not so easy to hide the dust and dirt in a modern interior. I hate the idea of having to leave the hotel to have breakfast: a common feature of NY hotels so RMG suited us fine. My day doesn't start until I've had my morning fix. The breakfast was fantastic. We loved the informality and really appreciated the variety of healthy choices and so much of it. We never had a problem with seating (you could take your breakfast to your room if you wished, there were trays available). I would be unhappy if the hotel management sacrificed the quality and quantity of the food available for the sake of a few extra chairs and tables! Lots of blueberries and raspberries on my cereal....what a luxury that was. And my first (not my last) cinnamon and raisin bagel! Wow! My husband is coeliac and as soon as I mentioned this to the lovely lady 'in charge' of the breakfast area, she dispatched a colleague to the nearest shop for gluten free cerals! That's never happened before and we were SO impressed. There were other special touches which we didn't really take advantage of: the tea/coffee machine was available all the time in the breakfast/eating area AND you were invited to order take-aways from the menus of various restaurants included in the hotel's information file in the room and eat them either in your room or in the breakfast area, using the hotels' cutlery etc.. How accommodating is that?!? The location was excellent for our needs and, because I took the advice from other 'trip advisor' reviewers, I contacted the hotel staff inadvance and requested quiet rooms. No problem! It was a great experience all round and I've already checked out the Room Mate website to find out where else in the world I can travel to get such a good deal. Yes, my future travel arrangements will be guided by the location of Room Mate Hotels. Barcelona and Buenos Aires here we come!

Reviews.Title: “All you could need for a stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: BUBBLES23Kent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grace from 26-30 December 2009. What can i say? What a great little hotel at such a good price! Granted, the rooms are a little small, but what do you expect in New York City - none of the hotel rooms are very big. The rooms themselves though were completely kitted out, lovely double bed, flat screen TV, DVD player and iPod dock as well as safety deposit box and small fridge. If you are like us and you are in NY to see the sights and do a bit of shopping then you don't really spend that much time in the hotel - but when we did, I have to say it was a pleasure! The staff were very helpful and the breakfast included in the tariff was a lovely extra, though you do need to be up either early or late to get a table - it seemed to be busiest between 8-9am (though it is open til midday!). The location...fantastic! right off Times Square, on W45th Street which itself has some really nice Irish pubs if you fancy a nice drink, they also do some really good food! If goood food is what you are after go to Bobby Van's - food is superb, it is pricey at $50 for a steak [that comes with no sides] but boy do you get 50 dollars worth of meat! There must have been half a cow on my husband's plate! All in all a fantastic stay, would definitely recommend the hotel - was clean and friendly and right in the hub of NY..."All you could need for a stay in New York"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kendal321
Reviews.Content: Overall a brilliant experience, from location- just a few minutes from times square and subway stations for easy access from the airport - to the room, which although not massive had everything you needed, with raised beds giving extra storage for luggage. Breakfast was a plus, always well stocked, could get very busy, but we always found somewhere to sit. The only downside was the free wireless which was a bit temperamental, but with a Starbucks just across the road this was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my husband will always return to Room Mate Grace”
Reviews.Author: ferbusatocarvalho
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel. The location is great, the room is fine and every day was clean, the breakfast was great and the price is amazing. If you want a great hotel with low price, you have to stay in Room Mate Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable hotel at great loacation!”
Reviews.Author: PrivateJ0ker
Reviews.Content: The room (standard room) was ok - not that big but I think a matter of fact in NYC. Nevertheless it was clean although there already were some traces of use on the furnishing. Staff was perfectly friendly! One point of critique which has to be mentioned is that the breakfast room is far to small for the amount of people accommodated in the hotel. I'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel7810
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from a fab trip to New York. RMG was great from the start - very friendly people. Comfortable beds and very modern rooms with lots of facilities and a lovely huge bathroom. Platform beds are a great idea - great for storing yuor suitcase underneath. Unlike some other reviewers we had a great view to the clock tower in time square - had we still been there for NYE we could have watched the ball drop from our room. We stayed on the 11th floor. Breakfast was very crowded but there was no shortage of food so I was happy. The pool, steam room, sauna and gym are great touches and despite the hotel being quite busy were never that crowded. Steam room was great after a day hitting the big muesums. The only thing I would add to the rooms is hooks - there was nowhere to hang your towel after using it. Also hooks for coats would be a good idea - the wardrobe is quite small so once you add your coats in it's half full. All in all a great stay. Thanks room mate grace

Reviews.Title: “A unforgettable white Christmas at Grace”
Reviews.Author: Georgiamia
Reviews.Content: The Grace hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel in New York. Great service & personnel who are always willing to help & make your stay the best. Great included breakfast in a sitting area decor with great taste. Lovely inside pool; even in cold weather. Our room was really comfortable. It included a king bed and a twin on the top. Our 5 year old girl was delighted with it. The room has it own refrigerator. At the main lobby they have a small shop were you can buy sodas, water or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly service, amazing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Erol A
Reviews.Content: Nearly nothing to complain about, the hotel is only a few meter (5 minutes) from times square, indoor pool is the perfect party location (therefore maybe not the best decission for family trips). Service people are very (!) friendly and competent. Breakfast more than ok (few days before I was at "a Hilton" the breakfast at Room Mate Grace was much better!) Only one remark in winter: the AC is not working well, if the room is cold it takes hours till the temperature increases. On the other side the upper beds became to hot to sleep... I would definitly stay again here on my next NY trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Room”
Reviews.Author: TaureanF
Reviews.Content: Loved the platform bed and the shower in the bathroom. It was very small, but thats to be expected in NYC. I would stay here again. the only problem that I had with the hotel is that they did not have a microwave anywhere in the hotel. We had gone out and spent a ton eating, brought back our left overs, and had to throw them away. I find it strange that the rooms have refrigerators, but there are no microwaves. Not even a public usage one. :(

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for a Hip Hotel - Rave in the Pool and All"”
Reviews.Author: E_of_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We did not like the platform beds. It was very akward to get in and out of. One side of the bed is flush with the wall. The bath did not have a door. There was a great deal of outside noise, even with the double glazed windows. The walls are very thin. We had to call each day to have towels delevered to our room as the miad took away the towels and did not replace them. There was no place to hang a towel so we could use it another time. There was no table and only one small chair. The lighting was so dim it was not possible to read after the sun set. The exercise room only had two bikes and no treadmill. Our biggest concern was the pool parties that spilled out into the lobby. That is not a scene we are comfortable with.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Edgy”
Reviews.Author: travNy
Reviews.Content: Small botique hotel very edgy and cool. The common areas wrap around a very cool pool that looks over to the bar. Nice music and the bartender is really aproachable the hotel is very botique small, so aware of that. This makes it cozy and the staff friendly not a usual for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a party, not so good for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Vegily
Reviews.Content: The hotel's lower level turns into a club at night, which is very cool if you are in the mood. The club is small but has a nice bar, with indoor pool and sauna. I've stayed at this hotel before and had an awesome time because I was able to take advantage of the club. On this trip, I was exhausted and not up for a night at the club, unfortunately. Going to sleep in this hotel is a chore because of the excessive street noise that goes on well into the morning hours. The hotel rooms are well designed and modern, although very small. I wasn't as impressed on this trip with their cleanliness. It had been about 2 years since my last visit, and I think the hotel's age was apparent. Hopefully they do more to keep the rooms fresh - perhaps new paint and carpet from time to time. I would not recommend this hotel for families, however it is a great place for young couples or those who like the night life. Its proximity to Times Square and the theater district makes it a good hotel for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting introduction to manhattan”
Reviews.Author: giselba
Reviews.Content: An interesting introduction to manhattan, trought a little hotel in the middle of the city with a nice wiew on the nearest skyscrapers. Nice rooms (deluxe type) and an original breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieInSaudi
Reviews.Content: the sauna and steam room was not running when I went to use it. It said it was on 24 hours a day. I would think they would turn it on if I would have asked but i didn't. Everything else was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, modern and stylish.”
Reviews.Author: carriemunich
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay very much. Rooms are great styled, welcome was warm and friendly. Location is absolutely great! WeÂ´ll be back some day!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and luxurous but not pompous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smauc
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - Luxurous but not pompous - the rooms are in excellent condition, clean and above all neatly designed. Service is friendly not more but that's enough... Breakfast is gorgeous (private atmosphere, excellent expresso) - and finally, the small swimming pool and sauna are just helping finishing with Beauty a hard day in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cal4000
Reviews.Content: Rude staff; not a good value for the price; security check to go to your room; small & claustrophobic room; inconvenient bed; loud music from the bar on the first floor could be on the fourth floor late at night. Will not be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: superinnie
Reviews.Content: It was our first time staying in New York and the hotel was the first plus we had! Very nice welcome, very helpfull, attending,... The room was spotless, very spacey (we stayed in a Queen room), breakfast had a large variety of choice and the hotel amenities (Pool!) were perfect! I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but avoid room number number 205!!!”
Reviews.Author: basel123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a great location, clean with small nice rooms, medium size but good breakfast... At first we stayed in room 305 just above a bar running music until 2am on a level that we had difficulties talking to each other in the room... After some arguments with the receptionist, we could finally move to another nice room in the fifth floor. We can recommend the hotel but make sure that your room is not on the third floorâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem on times square”
Reviews.Author: Trixyv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. We weren't expecting a great deal from a 3* hotel in the heart of Times Square, however, were pleasantly surprised!! On arrival, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and offered us help and advice with making the most out of our short time in New York. We took the elevator up to the 10th floor, and our first impression was that the hotel looked a bit "motel-like" with neon orange lighting, but do not be deceived. Our room was compact but very well designed with little storage areas under the bed, had plasma tv, dvd player, ipod docking station, telephone, aircon, iron, hairdryer, self-stockable mini bar, and wetroom with separate toilet. The room was well maintained and we had clean towels daily. The bed was just the most comfortable bed ever and was suspended higher than the windows so we looked down on crazy NYC from the comfort of our duvet! The hotel offered us continental breakfast (we thought we were room only basis), and it was yummy...pastries both sweet and savory, fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, tea, coffee, toast, juices etc. And this was served from 06.00-12.00! The pool was a really lovely touch to soothe the aching feet after sightseeing...our only complaint would be that the temperature needed bringing up a few degrees! There was a sauna and steam room too! The pool are was clean, had music playing, a swim-up bar, and twinkly lights...we honestly felt this was a part of the hotel that many guests missed the enjoyment of, but couldn't understand why??!! Highly recommend this hotel, and its location was just perfect! A+

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, but bring earplugs!"”
Reviews.Author: Ryanps74
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend found this hotel for me for a solo business trip and it seemed too good to be true...a $200+ hotel in the middle of Times Square that looked like it would offer a "W Hotel" type experience at a fraction of the cost. As I was staying at the Grace, I joked w/ my friends that it feels like a "V Hotel"; it's trying to be like the W but it comes up just short in style, comfort and overall vibe. However, for the price and location, Grace is an incredible value. You are literally in the middle of the Theater District in Times Square and only 15 blocks from Central Park, which is about a 15 minute walk. So you save that much more money by avoiding cabs and the subway b/c everything is pretty much in walking distance. To a degree, you are getting what you pay for: location, location, location. The rooms however, are tiny and construction is going on next door. If you are a light sleeper like me, then make sure you bring earplugs and sleeping pills. I was on the 12th floor by request, and I needed to buy those creature comforts to get a good night's sleep. I do regret not taking advantage of the swimming pool bar. Guys, if you're traveling alone, this is a killer place to stay. Lots of gorgeous women running around in the pool for private parties and DJ theme nights. It was very tempting to cancel my plans and stay at the hotel bar for Brazilian Night, trust me. For you biz travelers, the internet connection is spotty at best. Don't think you'll get a ton of work done in your room...there's hardly any space to do so and the internet connection runs hot and cold. Overall, if you're single, in your 20s and early 30s and want a W-like experience but don't want to pay $400 a night for it, stay here. Especially if you like a European-style atmosphere that almost feels like a very high-end youth hostel. If you're traveling with someone and seeking a romantic quiet weekend at a nice hotel, go someplace else. This is a hip, young establishment and you'll be annoyed at the loudness and hub-bub. All in all, I'm glad I stayed at Room Mate Grace. But, all things being equal, as a single 35-year-old w/ disposable income...in the future I'll pay the extra money for the added comfort and quiet of a nicer hotel experience. I prefer class to grit at this point in my life. In other words, I'll upgrade from the "V" back to the "W."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a central NY base”
Reviews.Author: alanward
Reviews.Content: A great and convenient hotel to stay in while visiting NY. Though the room was compact it is in the heart of Manhattan and ideal for people who want a hotel to simply sleep in. The en-suite bathroom was ample, very clean with a shower and toilet. There was also a safe that was free to use. A hairdryer was provided in the room as well as and an iron and ironing board if you're worried about creases in you clothes! The hotel has a pool, sauna, steam room and gym to help guests relax. Breakfast was continental style and excellent with toast, bagels, croissants, fruit, cereals, ham, cheese and boiled eggs (cold) and plenty of tea and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a good price!”
Reviews.Author: OzTink
Reviews.Content: We came to Grace after staying at another NY hotel for 5 nights (just for a different location) and it was a good hotel. We had no issues with street noise at all (was much much quieter than the first hotel) and we were concerned as there is construction right next door. The breakfast was fantastic and the room was adequate. We booked about 3 months early and got a decent deal ($240 + taxes). The toilet and shower were a little strange in the sliding cupboard - felt a little claustrophobic in there as there are no windows or glass (just 3 plastered walls and the back of a sliding mirror) and you are essentially in a cupboard. We only dealt with a few staff members in our short stay who were great, but one was not very friendly. She also couldn't answer me when I asked her where we could by some additional luggage. The customer checking out told me about a place on the same street (Jacks world or something). She also wouldn't answer anything until I told her what room number we were in and when we were checking out? Other than her, everyone else was lovely and I would stay here again if I wanted a central location.

Reviews.Title: “A small, comfortably and pleasent hotel in the middle of NY!”
Reviews.Author: stelug84
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, I recommend it especially for young people that would love the nice stay in the Grace. Room are nice and they have enough space and also the breakfast is very good to have untill 12.00 o'clock! The position is close to Times Square, i dont love it because too crowd but i wasn't a problem but help us to reach everywhere easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, trendy hotel VERY close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: NedL
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be near Times Square - it's only half a block away from Room Mate Grace. Rooms are reasonably small but well laid out with nice fittings. Pool, sauna, free fitness room are a bonus, as is the free continental breakfast served in the sitting area on Level 2. The bar downstairs by the pool was pretty quiet most nights we were there, but it's handy to be able to wander down for a drink if the mood takes you. Service was good, nothing spectacular but we had no issues there. All in all I'd definitely recommend RMG for people wanting a nicely appointed, clean room close to Times Square that isn't ridiculously expensive like some others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, did their best to accommodate our needs”
Reviews.Author: trendygalAustralia
Reviews.Content: We had a petite corner non smoking room and it was awesome!!!! bathroom bigger than i expected and we even had a view of city which was great. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some of the best New York can offer open minded travellers”
Reviews.Author: Hithel
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Everything during our stay was top notch, from the initial reception to check-out. The pool, breakfast, cleanliness, rooms, location and service are all things I remember warmly. I didn't have time to try the small gym but from a quick inspection it looked like it had enough to make a quick workout enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “This Grace loves Room Mate Grace”
Reviews.Author: femalenomaddc
Reviews.Content: Currently my favorite place to stay in NYC. I stayed for the second time after moving from a regrettably cheaper-but-less-clean nearby hotel. The location off West 45th puts you in the middle of Time Square action. The amenities are great; rooms modern and attractive and so clean; free wifi and DirecTV, and free continental breakfast substantial. Plus, Port Authority is just a few blocks away and can walk/cab over for travel connections, subway or airport shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: andharv
Reviews.Content: As a comfortable, reasonably priced (by New York standards), hotel the Grace ticks most boxes. Its in a great location just off Times Square. Its clean and the design is quite cool, although I have to admit not as cutting edge as I was expecting. The rooms particularly are rather unexceptional, with some of the design elements being more irritations than anything. Nonetheless, the beds are extremely comfortable. Its pretty noisy, but given the location that's inevitable. Saturday night is particularly noisy, the bar downstairs going until dawn. They lay on a good continental breakfast, but the room does get crowded so expect to share a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Atmosphere, Great Fight for Brekker”
Reviews.Author: CdrAdama
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and were very happy. The staff were very helpful and efficient, the place and decor were quirky and fun and the room was comfy. Whilst not large it was clean and well appointed and was fine for a sightseeing holiday. The location was great too just a few seconds walk from Times Square. About the only bad point was trying to get down for the breakfast. The breakfast bar was packed solid a few times and getting a seat was difficult. We gave up twice and went to the cafe next door. All in all though I would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: alita8
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The modern room was very clean and very comfortable. It had great touches - cosy pillows, ipod dock, iron, hairdryer, decent sized bathroom, lovely shower, weather forecast left on the bed, etc, etc. The breakfast was delicious, the service friendly and location was ideal. I would definitely stay here again when I next visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, good location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunky2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right near Times Square and walking distance to many attractions. There are some theatres right on the same street. The room was modern and well equipped with safe, iron, hair dryer. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The breakfast was great with fresh berries and fruit as well as pastries, cereal and yoghurt. I would stay again next time in NY. Only negative is that the internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lilimar
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a night when we were in town to celebrate our friends' anniversary.... My sis had always wanted to stay here, so I thought it would be fun to see what it was like. The price was reasonable, $208 ($180 + taxes) considering I didn't book the reservation as far in advance as I usually do. I thought the place would be too trendy and maybe a little snooty for us to feel comfortable, but the staff was friendly and accommodating... we even saw a couple with their baby, so that was a good sign. The room was a little small, but still roomy enough for the two of us to relax in before going out (I've stayed in much smaller and more cramped rooms in NYC). The bed was on a platform, very comfy, and had a little bench area for us to put our bags on. Also, I liked that there was a mini fridge, although it took up half the closet space, which was already small to begin with. Our room was on the 4th floor and overlooked 45th street, but it was actually pretty quiet considering how loud NYC street noise can be at times. The fixtures in the bathroom were nice (although I would've preferred it to be a bit brighter), and the rainshower was cool, but I wish that the shower had more of a separation from the rest of the bathroom... there was half wall and a shower curtain, but the water still splashed into the rest of the bathroom area on the floor. We took advantage of their continental breakfast the next morning, and it was packed, so we had to wait a bit for a seat. We ended up sitting near the pool, which was kinda cool, but I would've preferred a seat in the breakfast area, since it was brighter and didn't smell like chlorine. I wish that we were there longer, since we didn't get to try out all of the other facilities (pool/spa/sauna, gym, etc.). Overall we had a positive experience, and my sis was happy we got to stay there. I'd definitely stay there again, and I've seen some lower rates on their sites sometimes, so that's a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful place with dimmed light”
Reviews.Author: MikaelFinland
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful. The lobby and breakfast room too small because of the pool. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good location on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Man33years
Reviews.Content: If it's your first time in NYC, choose this hotel. It's easy to see all the other parts of the city. After all you're in MIDTOWN (!) Manhattan ;-) The price was okay, and the room was bigger than I had expected acually, from what I had heard in advance of the hotel-rooms in NYC. The room was very clean. But 3 drawbacks: Half of the staff was really helpfull and pleasant, but the other half seemed only semi-interested in the guests. The breakfast area was really small and over-crowded early in the morning. And, what's the deal with the swimming pool? Why not use the space to build a bigger bar/breakfast area? It was so easy to watch in on the people who used the pool thru the glass walls by the elevator and bar that my girlfirend and I were too shy to jump in... All in all, I enjoyed my stay. And despite these minor drawbacks I would recommend this hotell for couples (and small families with teenagers) who wants to live on the "crossroad of the world" at Times Square.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lauell
Reviews.Content: For 4 women on vacation, the bunkbed room was fabulous and just perfect for us. The included breakfast was also wonderful and almost unheard of in New York City. We had a great time while there and loved our stay. Had a couple of burned out light bulbs which we asked several times to be replaced and got no service, but other than that we were pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “great fan of room mate hotels in europe - disapointed by NYgrace hotel”
Reviews.Author: nbrd66
Reviews.Content: first room confortable on 10th floor second room on 8th floor has just been fresh painted - so toxic smells -:((( and no black curtains to avoid light early in the morning :((( to replace it we were given another one on the 3rd floor : impossible to sleep before 3AM because of a party at the swimming pool (we were told party ends at 2AM but as fun was going on the manager extended it later :((( night reception never ever said they were sorry for this disturbance :((( which should have been the least as we stayed for a total of 17 nights ... breakfast room too crowded to start a good day in NYC :((( queue to get a seat then queue to help ourselves :((( but it seems the hotel direction prefers to keep sofas in order to organize evening parties at the swimming-pool instead of placing small tables to welcome more people for breakfast :((( finally we seldom used the pool always over crowded by these parties :((( and the sauna and the spa were very often out of use because of the parties :((( sorry not to be able to recommend grace hotel as we could do for several room mate hotels in spain (laura - oscar - alicia in madrid + marina in valencia) ! hope you do make good use of this review ... to improve grace !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtwaz
Reviews.Content: We reserved a "Petite" room, and were concerned it might be uncomfortably tiny, but our room was quite spacious (perhaps they gave us an upgrade?). We had a king-size bed; a small table that pulled up to a bench, with a chair; a closet with hanging space and 3-4 shelves; a bathroom with a nice big counter and a long narrow shelf below the mirror; a spacious shower; and a toilet room that closed with a sliding door. There was a lot of empty floor space -- plenty for a chest of drawers, which would have been nice. We had heard that the lower floors could be noisy at night (from the parties in the pool area), so we requested an upper floor and got a room on the eleventh floor, which was plenty quiet. Of course, there are always city noises, but the double windows helped to muffle those. Other amenities: a safe large enough for a laptop computer, a small mini-fridge (empty), hairdryer, iron and small ironing board, magazines, and a binder with menus from local restaurants. The breakfast was available from 6am to noon, and included bread (sliced white and wheat, bagels, croissants, muffins, etc.), fruit (apples, oranges, bananas, raspberries, blueberries), yogurt, ham, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, cereals, coffee, tea, cocoa, juice, milk. The staff was quick to re-stock anything getting low. The location was great. 5 minutes or so from subway stops, and within walking distance of Times Square, MoMA, Rockefeller Center, and lots of other tourist attractions. There's a deli two doors down that is a good place to get snacks if you want something quick, or if you want to eat in your room. The 2nd floor area where breakfast is served is also available the rest of the day if you want a comfortable place to eat or hang out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. On our last day, as our bellhop stored our luggage so we could see a few last sights, we mentioned that we would be back around 2:45 to take a cab to the airport, and when we arrived, he had a cab there waiting for us. Loved the funky decor, loved the breakfast, loved our room, would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: MusicMomof3
Reviews.Content: My two teenagers and I stayed overnight at the Grace Hotel while in town for a show. We found it very clean, very pleasant. The service people were all very friendly and helpful. Bring your bathing suit: the heated pool is an oasis in itself. The lighting is dim in the pool area, with soothing music playing softly. Ahhhhh. The first floor did really get hopping at night, and some of the loud music did filter up to our room. Next time, I'll request a room on a higher floor; we were on the 3rd floor, which is just above the main floor. The continental breakfast was very nice; a buffet of bagels, sandwich fixings, croissants, fresh fruit, muffins and doughnuts. OJ and excellent coffee. A room with a king size bed and twin upper bunk was perfect for the 3 of us. The only drawback for us would've been the see-through shower curtain for the shower, since there is no door to close b/w the shower area and the rest of the room. I'd advise you bring a few clothespins and pin a bed sheet to the see-through curtain. We simply only used it after swimming, with our bathing suits still on. Very conveniently located in theater district/Times Square area. Also, there are cafe-type restaurants--very casual, right near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINGMINNEAPOLIS
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location of this hotel. You really could not beat it-it was close to Times Square, subway, etc. The bed situation was really interesting. I'm not an older person but I kept thinking that if someone older or someone that was not super acrobatic stayed in this room, they would probably end up sleeping on the floor. The bed was on a rather high platform with entry from only one side. I had to crawl up, and crawl over my husband to get to the other side of the bed. It was actually quite amusing after awhile. But it did have a large closet space, which was amazing for a New York hotel. Loved the decor and the whole vibe of the place.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRIPOP
Reviews.Content: Very modern deco. Room was cute, not big but large enough. Breakfast is good and very relaxing when taken in front of the pool . The service is great, always helpful. I recommend to stay on the higher floors (we were in the 16th floor) in case of parties around the pool that can be noisy if you sleep just upstairs. The location is just perfect, very close to broadway and times square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with lots of style”
Reviews.Author: Lul81
Reviews.Content: The room we got in Room Mate Grace was really fun. Unique showers, big comfortable bed, lots of space for luggage. In general this hotel is stylish. Hotel is clean, service is helpful (allowed us to check-in at 8AM), and their breakfast is a nice way to start your day (especially if you like sweet stuff for breakfast). The location is very central with lots of subway stations nearby. The only problem with the room was a constant machine noise coming from the roof of the building next to the hotel. The windows of the room did not seal this noise very well. Tip for those arriving from Newark Airport - take the USA Coach bus (just outside of the terminal) and get off at Port Authority. From there it is a 10 min walk to the hotel. Round trip costs 25$.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Isazou
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Grace Hotel. The staff was incredible, always ready to help and always with a smile. The heated pool is perfect to relax after a long day of shoppind or sightseeing. The breakfast in the morning is really good, fresh fruits, cereals, different sort of breads and muffins and also a nice coffee machine (cappucinno, latte) which is available 24 hours. The location is great, directly in Times Square, less than 5 minutes to walk to 5th Avenue, 15 minutes walk to Central Park, 15 minutes to walk to 34th street (Macy's and lots of other nice stores). On Saturday night, there was a DJ at the pool and everyone was dancing, that was a lot of fun. We will stay there on our next visit to NYC for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: martijn79
Reviews.Content: Room Mate Grace NY. Reception personal was very friendly and helpfull, Rooms where nice, clean and comfortable. People in the breakfast area where not fast and friendly, very grumpy to eacht other and don't know how to laugh and smile. We had to ask every morning for orangejus, cleaning the table, cups, etc. The breakfast itself/ the food was good. We would come back for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: travelagentoslo
Reviews.Content: We have been to NYC quite a few times. This is def the best place to stay! Excellent location - only 1 min walk from Times Square. We stayed here for 3 nights, missed it when we left! We were amazed at how cool the hotel was. Amazing design, trendy, hip and stylish. Cool hotel rooms, small but with everything u need. Very European like/Ikea style. Amazing free breakfast with fresh bagels and freshly squeezed orange juice. Cool pool and sauna. Fitness room. Free internet access! 24hr reception with a small shop. The hotel has a popular bar, nighly DJs and parties. Ask for a room on a high floor if u want a quiet room. Very nice staff. Will def stay here again! Be sure to check out a stand up comedy show when you're in NYC - At Dangerfield's, Broadway comedy club, Laugh factory etc.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic, clean boutique not for claustrophobics.”
Reviews.Author: AustinFW
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with funky vibe, had availability (thankfully) when just about every other hotel in NYC was full. Room was clean and tiny -- cozy but would have been tight with 2 people. Front desk was a bit chaotic. Fun common areas, hip clientele. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great situation”
Reviews.Author: Loustic57
Reviews.Content: The breakfast plae is too small, not very practicable and ofen busy.

Reviews.Title: “Such a zen hotel next to everything!”
Reviews.Author: kaaiia
Reviews.Content: Stylish, peaceful hotel few steps away from Times Square. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is relaxing and zen place that, in our opinion, balanced NYC buzz. We had a standard room, which was is our opinon roomy enough. It is true though, that the space is designed for couples etc, meaning that it's basically one room. We were happy to see, that there was an empty fridge to fill with your own foods&drinks. (Something was sold in the reception as well.) There's a quite good deli/shop almost next to the hotel, so it was easy to buy snacks. Our room at the 12th floor was peaceful and quiet, but on the other hand we had requested a quiet room. The breakfast was healthy and nice, although it was a little crowded at 9 am. There are tables available at the pool, too, so if the tables are occupied, you may also check downstairs. We truly enjoyed the relaxing athmosphere and chill out music played. We had few drinks at the lounge bar on Sunday. The bartender was very friendly and polite. By the way, most of the other quests seemed to be Spanish speaking. Also the staff spoke Spanish. There were some little thing that could have been better: One of the two elevators was broken twice during our week's stay. Our keys didn't work our last whole day there. Mistakes happen, but the thing that bothered me was that when asking to fix them, the staff member didn't apologized. It also took a while to get our bags from the luggage room, since there was only one staff member doing that and there were few other quests leaving at the same time. Our driver had to wait with car on the street (and that makes New Yorkers mad!). But, as you can see, the negative sides are minor. We definately would recommend this hotel to anyone + would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, close to subway stations, lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BARTdG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room Mate Grace for 10 nights. We liked it very much, especially breakfast was great. It's close to Times Square, which is just a bit too busy, but there are two subway stations nearby. There is a swimming pool! The only downside I can think of is the poor WiFi reception in our room. Definetly great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a very short trip”
Reviews.Author: 30sfemale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our thirties and we stayed at this hotel when we were in town for a wedding. We stayed for one night. I think the room and especially the bathroom would have been too small for us if it had been a longer stay. The layout of the room is quirky and feels stylish, but the bathroom offers no privacy. It would not have been a comfortable experience to use the toilet, etc. if I had been traveling with anyone other than my husband or a very close family member because the door of the bathroom is just a mirror that slides in front of the toilet -- in other words, the bathroom is basically on one side of the room, and the bed is on the other side, and there is no separate room for a bathroom. The shower was dark and the grout probably could have used some tilex. But the lobby was very trendy, with the pool which my husband used. But the drinks were very pricey. I didn't find the place to be too loud on a Saturday night and the concierge was helpful. The walls are thin. We heard a couple being intimate on our way to our room! It's a comfortable stylish place to stay, it sort of has a modern almost ikea feel to it. I would definitely recommend to young people and to the 35 and up crowd if it's a very short visit and you want trendiness at a reduced cost. The parking is a block away. Definitely not a place to travel with a business relation.

Reviews.Title: “great except for nightclub/ pool party on weekends downstairs”
Reviews.Author: vixiie
Reviews.Content: on weekends the pool, sauna and steam room area is out of bounds because they are transformed into a gay club so music may be too loud for those on the lower floors. otherwise excellent location and facility

Reviews.Title: “We hope to return to this hotel every time we go to New York City!”
Reviews.Author: kimskaps
Reviews.Content: A very unique hotel with the best of service, A 24 hour pool in the City that never sleeps, was a real PLUS! Held our luggage before check in and after check in while we continued to enjoy the sightseeing of the City. Thanks again and hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloppychops
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. Caught the train from New Jersey and a 15 minute walk from Penn St. The hotel is located just off Times Square so for the first time visitor to New York its perfect. Although check in wasn't till the usual 2pm we were allowed to check in as our room was vacant and ready. Don't know about other people but its always a nice touch. Like most other New York hotels it errs on the small side but who wants a huge room in the "City that never sleeps"? The room was very nicely designed with good use of space. The usual plasma screen TV was wall mounted so you could watch TV in bed. Separate toilet and shower which was very clean (always a good sign). We also liked that the refrigerator was empty so you could fill it up with whatever you liked either from the reception or outside. Unlike most NY hotels of this size, it has a small pool which we didn't use. Like many posters breakfast can be crowded and busy.
